(you) “Yes sir.”
You watch the vast variety of pokemon pour out of the bus and notice a few wave or say hi to Rai. Rai responds back with a grin and a hello. You then notice a floatzel jump off the bus with a buizel, vaporeon, and milotic following it. You hear Rai call out to the floatzel, but either the floatzel didn’t hear him or it ignored Rai. The vaporeon responds back to Rai.
(???) “Morning Rai.”
(Rai) “Morning Shiki.”
You still are peeking out and notice the last off the kids walk into school. You wait until they are guaranteed not to see you and you walk out and get Rai’s attention. He finally notices you and puts you his shoulder so you are hidden, just in case.
(you) “Who was that floatzel and everybody else following him?”
(Rai) “That was Jet, the buizel was his little brother Storm, the milotic was Miku, and as you already heard, the vaporeon was Shiki. They all stay in one house.”
You nod and Rai stands up to stretch.
(Rai) “Well time to go back in.”
(you) “Why? It’s so nice out and I can be out of the bag here.”
(Rai) “I know you like to be out of the bag and I can see why, but I gotta go back in the school.”
He reaches a hand up for you to climb on, and although you didn’t want to, you climbed on so you could go back to the bag. Rai levels his hand with the gap and you slide down the side and land safely on the bottom.
(you) “Well I hate to keep bothering you and being a pain in your side, but why do we have to back in the school?”
(Rai) “Well you’re still not a bother, you’re just new to this place and you’re curious. I’d be the same way if our roles were switched. Well, anyway, the reason we have to go back in is because…
1122221211211121.title: Here We Are

11222212112111212.content:
“…The bells are about to ring for class to start.”
(you) “That sounds like a good enough reason to go in.”
(Rai) “I was hoping you would agree.”
(you) “Could you please answer just one more question before we go in?”
(Rai) “Of course. What is it?”
(you) “Are you sure I’m not as bother to you? I mean all I’ve done is eat your food, make you my caretaker, and interfere with your plans.”
(Rai) “I promise you are not an issue or hassle or any kind of problem. If you were, I would’ve left you somewhere to fend for yourself. Besides, you’re a friend like Aura. Aura has my back and although you two are different, you seem like you act the same. So thanks for being a friend and quit worrying about irritating me. I’m fine as long as you are.”
(you) (brief pause) “Rai, thanks for everything.”
Rai opens the flap and reaches in for you. He holds you at eye level and grins.
(Rai) “It’s no big deal. Just promise you aren’t going to be a jerk or anything.”
(you) “Yes sir. I promise I won’t be jerk as long as Rai isn’t a jerk.”
(Rai) “We have a deal.”
He sets you back down in the bag carefully. Closing the flap, Rai walks towards the door and opens it. You feel the bag get hit a few times and you teeter for a little while each time, then regain your balance. You climb to the top of the bag and once again, scout out all the pokemon in the school. You stare in awe at all the pokemon, until your eye catches a lucario and floatzel talking by a locker. You feel Rai slow down a little bit, then get back to speed. You assume he too saw Aura and Jet talking. You keep your eye on the pair and see a shocked face appear on the floatzel, but you then lost them in the crowd. You notice Rai walk through a doorway and take a seat towards the back of the classroom. He sets the bag down flat on the desk and opens it, but leaves it open facing the front of the class. After adjusting to the shift, you move to a position where you can see out of the bag, but still remain in shadow so no one can see you. You look out for a teacher, but notice nobody except you and Rai are the only ones in the classroom. Rai spins the bag around and you fall over. He looks in the bag and you glare at him while laying on your side.
(Rai) “Are you alright? I’m sorry.”
(you) (standing up) “I’m fine and it’s alright. Just please try to be more careful.”
(Rai) “Yes sir.”
(you) “You’ve got more authority so you are the sir here and can I ask some more questions?”
(Rai) “Sure, fire away”
(you) “Where is everybody?”
(Rai) “There is still about 5 minutes left, and nobody except for a few come in until about 2 minutes are left.”
(you) “Alright, number 2. So why didn’t you stop and talk to Jet and Aura? I felt you slow down, but then you just kept on moving.”
(Rai) “Well I was going to stop and ask Jet why he didn’t reply but I didn’t because he was talking and if Aura would’ve sensed you, we would have had a major problem. Besides Aura and Jet are in this class, so although we aren’t safe yet, we are a little bit better off and I can always ask Jet in here what happened.”
(you) “Well, I’d like to ask a few more questions, but I’ve bothered you enough and I need to go back into hiding. See ya later.”
(Rai) “No you haven’t. Though going back to hide is probably a good idea. See you after class.”
Rai closed the bag, carefully turned it so it could stand and you wouldn’t fall, and set it back on the floor. You adjust again and sit down for a second and wait until you hear footsteps come walking through the door. As they walked by Rai’s bag, your small size made their footsteps seem like miniature tremors. You tried to stay in one place, but with each step of theirs, you would occasionally lose your balance and take a few steps of your own.
(you) (thinking to yourself) “Great. Can barely stay in one place and these seem like the lighter pokemon. I would hate to see someone Rai’s size walk by. Probably can’t even get halfway up the bag before I fall back down, so no more scouting for now. Hmm… what to do during class. None of my usual luxuries, so I’m going to have to improvise. Maybe Rai has something I can mess with during class. Gotta make sure I don’t mess his stuff up too bad. I’d hate to see him mad because I couldn’t keep myself entertained without ruining his stuff.”
You wander through the bag and realize that not much light can get in. Trying your best to see with what light you had, you look at all his books and other things in his bag. You see a book that had a ringed binding, but couldn’t tell what it said on it. There were a few folders and you remembered Rai had the notebook on the desk. You were on the side of the bag when you noticed another bag. You walk up to it and recognize what kind of bag it was: a brown paper bag. You then knew it held Rai’s lunch and left it at that. Snooping through his lunch was both pointless and rude. Walking on someone’s food didn’t help it taste any better and you really weren’t hungry. Although you didn’t have breakfast, you usually didn’t have breakfast and that wasn’t an issue. You walk to the opposite end of the bag and notice a pencil and some paper. You check the paper to be sure it is unused and rip off a piece proportional to paper your size. Against your better judgment, you break the tip off the pencil and move to one corner. With part-pencil and some shred of paper, you start to draw and sketch things around you. You modeled the looks of being in the bag and attempted at drawing some pokemon. You drew all over the paper until no more room remained. Then you looked at all the drawings. You drew some cubes and other geometric figures and looked on them with pride as they seemed flawless, even though you know they weren’t. But you then looked at your pokemon drawings and didn’t feel as confident about them. On each, you seemed to notice one little flaw or two and that ruined your view of how good they looked. One spot was too big or small, or another spot seemed too long or short. Without an eraser, they could never be perfect. Regardless, you decided that they were good despite the flaws. Then exhaustion kicked in and you attempted at denying it. Eventually giving up, you set the paper shred and pencil tip off to the side and try to get comfy.
(you) (thinking to yourself) “Well, everything is alright so far. Rai is an awesome guardian. Glad he was there to get me and not somebody cruel. I wonder if he really is alright with me being here. I’d be surprised if he really is, since not many people will talk to me for very long. (sigh) I hope my family isn’t worried about me or any of my friends. What am I saying, my friends probably won’t even notice me being gone. They hardly ever noticed me before, almost like I was a ghost or something. I just wish I could be accepted and not be such an outcast. (chuckling) I’m such a hypocrite, telling Rai to stay positive and here I am thinking negatively. We can’t work well with each other unless we both follow through. Guess I need to try harder. Maybe Rai and I can both improve our social skills and not seem stuck up to everybody else. Grrr, there I go again with the negativity. I need my friends here; maybe they could help the both of us.” (yawn)
You started to feel more and more tired with each thought and you were about to fall asleep, when a bell rang. You decided that must be the bell for class to start. A few seconds later, just before you fell asleep, you hear one voice from the front of the class.
(teacher) “Good morning class.”
(entire class) “Good morning Miss Blaze”
You chuckle as Rai’s voice is the quietest and can barely be heard above everybody else’s. You fall asleep and wake up…
11222212112111212.title: TIme for Class

112222121121112121.content:
You wake up in a different class with the bag once again open and laying flat on a desk. You stand up and stretch, then walk over to Rai. He notices you walking over and puts down what he was reaching for.
(Rai) (whispering the whole time) “Nice to see you awake.”
(you) “Sorry. I didn’t have much to do and didn’t want to destroy anything. Besides sleeping feels so nice.”
(Rai) “Well, at least someone enjoys my classes. Could you please duck down so I can get my books without smacking you and you still stay hidden?”
(You) (taking a knee and dropping your head) “Yes sir.”
Rai reached in for the ringed book and you still can’t see what’s on it, this time because the top is face up. But while he is pulling out the book, a tip-less pencil rolls out and nearly trips you. Rai notices it, picks it up and examines it.
(you) “Uh-oh…”
(Rai) “What happened with this? I thought you said you didn’t destroy anything.”
(you) (scratching the back of your head) “Um… well… you see what had happened was I didn’t immediately fall asleep and I decided that since there was unused paper and something I could write with, that maybe I could pass the time by drawing. Sorry.”
You look up at Rai and notice a quiet laugh.
(you) “What’s so funny?”
(Rai) “Well, for one I found a use for broken pencil tips and two, it’s comical how you couldn’t wait for this class.”
(you) “What do you mean ‘wait for this class’?”
(Rai) “Well you see, the class we are in now IS drawing class.”
(you) (falling over) “What?! Oh come on, the one class I want to participate in and I can’t.”
(Rai) (silently laughing) “Well, I’m sorry, but that’s how it goes. It’s almost time for you to hide and me to set the bag down. But before you go back in, I just wanted to say a few things.”
(you) “Alright, so what are they?”
(Rai) “Well for both not being social, we sure talk to each other a lot.”
(you) “Meh. For some reason, antisocial people tend to talk a lot with other antisocial people.”
(Rai) (Grabbing the rest of his stuff) “Sorry for not getting you breakfast. I wasn’t thinking straight. Also should I let you sleep next time?”
(you) “It’s alright about breakfast. I usually don’t eat anyway and unless it’s necessary to wake me up, could you please let me sleep.”
(Rai) “If that’s what you want, alright.”
(you) “Thanks Rai. See you later”
(Rai) “Anytime James. See you after class.”
(you) “Wait, one more thing. Why don’t you call me Jai?”
(Rai) “ I don’t know. Just more natural to say James, I guess. Why, do you want to be called Jai?”
(you) “No, I just was curious. I really don’t care.”
(Rai) “Alright, after class sometime. See you then.”
Rai closed the bag and carefully set it down. Just in time too, because as soon as it was on the ground, some kids walked in to take their seats. A few more minutes passed and the rest of the class and the teacher had walked in. The bell rang and you took a peek at the teacher. It was a smeargle who stood in front of a large easel.
(Smeargle) “Good morning class.”
(entire class) “Good morning Miss Sketch.”
You chuckle at Sketch being her last name and she was the drawing teacher. Regardless, you wanted to see the drawings and climbed to the top of the bag and sat on a book.
(Miss Sketch) “Okay class today, we will continue on our drawings of Latios and Latias.”
Your jaw dropped as you really wanted to draw them or at least learn a good technique of how to draw the pair. You tried to watch her lines as she drew them, but you were too far away and too small to see around Miss Sketch. All you could do was listen, but her saying “now continue this line to here” or “make sure this section is proportional to this section” really made staying awake pointless. Giving up on the lesson, you climbed down and found a comfortable place to sleep. You then woke up…
112222121121112121.title: Drawing Class

1122221211211121212.content:
You were awakened by someone poking you. You tossed and turned, hoping that whoever was poking you would leave you alone. Eventually you gave in and sat up. Looking around you saw daylight and a massive hand. You go up and walked over to the hand and shook it… or at least tried. You look up at Rai and he looks back down at you.
(Rai) “I know it’s nice to catch a few z’s, but it’s time for lunch.”
(you) “Sorry, but its way too hard to get up when you’re happily asleep.”
(Rai) (chuckling) “I’m with you there. Here’s your lunch.”
Rai was handing you a berry, but he held it outside the bag. You look at the berry then up at his face, puzzled. He obviously understood what your concern was.
(Rai) “It’s alright, you can come out. I’m out in the middle of nowhere and nobody can see you from here.”
(you) “Are you sure? I don’t want to be noticed or be trouble.”
(Rai) “I’m sure everything will be alright. Remember, we’ve got to stay positive.”
(you) (sigh) “Yeah, you’re right. Here I come.”
You slowly walked out and climbed up to Rai’s shoulder. He handed you your berry and you began wolfing it down. You noticed his lunch was a sandwich and juice.
(you) “So since we’re safe to talk here, what did Jet say about this morning?”
(Rai) “It was weird because neither Jet, nor Aura was in class and they’re never absent.”
(you) “Huh, guess there is a first for everything.”
(Rai) “I guess so. How was drawing from in the bag?”
(you) “It was terrible. I’ve been wanting to learn how to draw Latios and Latias for a while, but I could never see what she meant by ‘drawing this line’.”
(Rai) “That sucks, here, tell me what you think of mine.”
He pulls his sketchpad out and opens to the page with drawings of the duo. You look at his book and envy his drawings. Then from a far table away, a few girls start laughing your direction. You crouch a little further so they can’t see you guaranteed, but all Rai did was give a quiet, angry growl. You crouch even further down and put your hands over your head, unsure what Rai was going to do. He held his head down, folded up his sketchpad, and put it away. Fearful of what he may do, you do the only thing you can: praise Rai.
(you) (stuttering and fearfully) “I e-envy t-t-those pictures. I w-wish I could d-d-draw th-that we-well.”
Rai quieted his growl a little, but it was still there and enraged.
(Rai) (solid, quiet, and hateful) “In the bag.”
Without a second to breathe or think, you run all the way to the bag and jump inside. You crawl your way to the back and cower. Afraid of what might happen you organize Rai’s things to make a barrier, though you knew it would be absolutely useless in any case. Cradling yourself, you eventually lay down and try to sleep. You hear a bell ring and feel Rai shut the bag and without a care, stand up and start walking. You were tossed around and felt a little pain after getting hit with the pencil. Unfortunately, you could only endure it because saying the wrong thing could be critical error. You were paralyzed with fear and had a headache, but managed to fall asleep. You...
1122221211211121212.title: Chow Time

choices: Rai is hitting the outside of his cave
11222212112111212122.content:
As you slept, you had a nightmare. It began with you and Rai being at the same height, and you both stared in awe and started a conversation. You talked for a while until a different voice cut in. You were uncertain of what the person said, but Rai clearly heard as he seemed suddenly enraged with eyes glowing a bloody red. You tried getting his attention by talking to him, but your voice fell on deaf ears. Then the unexpected happened, Rai threw a punch to your chest. You embraced the hit and staggered backwards. You looked at your chest, noticing an imprint from Rai’s fist, then you looked at Rai. Something seemed different about Rai then. It wasn’t his anger, it wasn’t his stance, but it was his height. You look at him and think he is continuously growing, but when an unknown shadowy figure floats by, you then realized that Rai wasn’t growing, but you were shrinking. You stopped shrinking when you were about your normal height compared to Rai. Still feeling intense pain from the previous hit, you drop to a knee and try to recover. Unsure of what came over Rai, you stand up and try talking to him. Again, your voice went unnoticed and see Rai cock his arm back, preparing to throw another punch. You roll out of the way and decided talking was useless. Rai just kept throwing punches, alternating arms. Finally, you trip and fall flat on your face. You look up at Rai as he throws what you expected to be his final punch. You instinctively drop your head and cover it. Then the punch arrived, hitting you, and recoiled back. You feel pain all over your body, and with your remaining strength, picked your head up, only in time to see Rai throw another punch. It again hits and again it hurts, but you start ignoring the punches and start worrying about the situation.
(you) (thinking to yourself) “What’s going on? That’s the third hit and I’m still alive! Why? And how am I not flat yet? It doesn’t feel like they’re crushing me but rather… bending me. But that’s not possible, I break, not bend! (looking at your lower half and torso) AHHHH! I’M BENDING! His punches hurt like crazy, but they aren’t killing me.”
Rai throws one last punch and walks away, still red-eyed and angry. You try to stand up and notice your entire frame is bent. Then, as if on queue, you seem to return to your normal form, leaving only pain to reside in your body. But in the distance, a giant beam is heading your direction.
(you) “Great recover from one problem and another rushes to take its place. First the punches, now Hyper beam. I’m really hoping this is only a dream and but what if that dying in a dream thing is true? I never proved it when I fell from the sky because that was real. At least I know when I wake up from a nap, I’m not going to end up in another realm anymore.”
Finally with Rai giving a battle cry, the beam reached you. You woke up in a cold sweat, breathing heavily. You look around and notice the bag is laying flat and open on a table. You cautiously walk out and look around to see Rai’s cave. Looking towards the mouth of the cave, you see Rai walking out. He turned to his left and you saw an enraged face. Fearful of both your nightmare and Rai, you run to the edge of the table and slide down a leg. You sprint to Rai’s room and seek refuge under the table by his bed.
(you) “I hope I don’t make Rai any angrier, but right now it’s just too scary to be near him. I wonder if he…
You are cut off by what feels like earthquakes. The entire cave is shaking and you see little pebbles fall from the ceiling. You freeze and hear what sounds like Rai grunting in a somewhat rhythmic style.
11222212112111212122.title: It's Your Nightmare

choices: Aura and Ryu decide to stay a little longer
112222121121112121221.content:
Rai must’ve been hitting his walls because it seemed to quake after Rai’s grunting. The quaking stops and you hear Aura talking to Rai outside.
(Aura) “Rai! Is everything alright? I felt the quakes and thought the entire mountain was experiencing an earthquake!”
(Rai) (growling) “Just peachy.”
(Aura) “Take some deep breaths and let’s talk about it.”
(Rai) (growling) “Let’s not, but say we did.”
(Aura) “No, we have to talk. This whole mountain is shaking and that’s dangerous to everyone, including us.”
(Rai) “…”
(Aura) “Let’s go in and relax a bit, alright?”
(Rai) (defeated tone) “Okay.”
You hear the duo walk in and pull out chairs. Light footfalls walked around and you heard a cabinet open, shut, then the sound of running water. The footfalls continue after the water stops running and the footfalls are silenced by the sound of two chairs being pulled in. You exhale the breath you had unconsciously been holding. You resume breathing silently and listen to the pair talk.
(Aura) “Here, you look a little thirsty.” (Slides the bag off to the side and passes to Rai the water)
Rai had started breathing deeply and occasionally stopped, presumably to take a sip of water. The silence resumed, with the only sound being of Rai breathing.
(Aura) “Alright, you seem a little calmer. Let’s talk about what happened. You can say anything, because it will just be us here, so nobody else can say anything.”
You quietly laughed to yourself as that wasn’t completely true. But you didn’t care what Rai said, if it was about you or somebody else.
(Rai) “Well I guess what’s getting to me is everybody talking trash about me behind my back. That and I feel like I’m letting someone down.”
(Aura) “Who is this ‘somebody’?”
(Rai) “I’d rather not say.”
(Aura) “Okay, I’ll respect that. So what about everybody seems to be getting to you now? I mean you know that they talk trash about you all the time, but what seems to be striking that chord now of all times?”
(Rai) “Well I think this ‘person’ will think I’m pathetic and want nothing to do with me.”
(Aura) “Mhm. I see what you’re saying.”
Your fear slowly turned to anger because Rai’s acting like you’re any different than he is. You only remember the conversation you had about your similarities. To make sure he knew you still existed, you picked up a loose pebble and walked to the doorway. Hiding along the side so Aura would not see you and with all your might, you threw the rock as high and far as you could, then quietly walked back to the table and took cover under it. You were safely under when the pebble hit the ground.
(Aura) “Huh? Must’ve fallen from the ceiling.”
(Rai) “Yeah, maybe.”
(Aura) “Well, I guess the only way to help would be to actually talk to the person and be sure.”
(Rai) “Yeah I guess. Thanks Aura. I’ll see you later”
(Aura) “Whoa, who said I’m going anywhere? As I recall, you told Ryu that next time, we could maybe eat with you and you don’t look too busy, so how about it?”
You started laughing, trying not to let Aura hear you, but it was hard as you knew that Rai didn’t really have a choice.
(Rai) “Well, I guess you’re right with me not being busy, so I guess so.”
(Aura) “It’s alright, we aren’t going to talk trash about you to your face or behind your back. I’m going to go get my brother, so I’ll be a while. Try not to destroy the mountain while I’m gone.”
(Rai) “Since you asked so nicely, I guess I won’t. See you in a bit.”
With that, Aura nodded and took off, leaving Rai at the table alone. He stood up and went over to the bag and began searching through it. As he did that you walked to doorway and just stood there, tapping your foot. He didn’t seem to notice and you decided a whistle should get his attention. You whistle as loud as you can and watch as he slowly turns your way. He looked a bit ashamed and you run his way. You scurry up a chair and look up at him.
(you) “And you think you’re pathetic? I’m shorter than your pencils and about the same weight as your eraser. I don’t think you’re either pathetic or a failure. I’m still alive and well so you aren’t letting me down, and I’m still here talking to you, because you aren’t pathetic. The only person here that should be worried about being pathetic or a letdown is me.”
(Rai) “But you’re not.”
(you) “And neither are you, so what made you think that way?”
(Rai) “I don’t know, maybe I’m just not used to having others say good things and mean them.”
(you) “Regardless, we both need to seriously start thinking more on the brighter side. Agreed?” (stretching out your hand)
(Rai) “Agreed” (completing the handshake with a claw)
(you) “Well you got guests that will be arriving soon and I’m not invited, so could you please get me some dinner and I’ll be on my way.”
(Rai) “Well maybe I’ll amend that dinner invitation to include you.”
(you) “Please don’t. I know you’re not exactly social either, but I’m at the disadvantage, socially, ability wise and size wise.”
(Rai) “I won’t. We both agreed on you staying hidden for as long as you can. One question though, where were you when you threw that pebble?”
(you) (chuckling) I was hiding behind the doorway. I was sure Aura was going to turn around and see me.”
(Rai) “I did too. Sorry about earlier.”
(you) “Not trying to be rude, but I think its best to talk about it when Aura and Ryu aren’t coming here. Right now I need to go back to hiding and get some food for the hideout if you would please get me some.”
(Rai) “Of course I will.”
He turned around and went to his refrigerator. He pulled out a bottle of water and a berry.
(you) “I know I might be there a while, but I don’t need a whole bottle of water.”
(Rai) (chuckling) “Just be patient.”
He then opened it and drank a little over half of the water. Then he screwed the cap back on and picked you up, carrying the berry and bottle in one hand, and you in the other.
Crouching, he then puts the supplies under the table and you right next to them. He unscrews the bottle and sets the cap under the lip of the bottle.
(Rai) “Here’s the idea behind this; if you need water, push down on the top and water should come out in the cap and you sip out of the cap.”
(you) “Awesome. So when you’re done chilling with Ryu and Aura, can I discuss the day with you?”
(Rai) “Sounds like a great plan. I probably should get out there; they will be here anytime soon, so I will see you later.”
(you) “I wish you the best of luck.”
(Rai) “Wait, before they get here, hold on.”
Rai runs back for his bag and sets it down by the table in his bedroom.
(Rai) “In case you get bored. Just don’t destroy anything.”
(you) “Aye aye.”
Rai walked out just as Aura and Ryu walked in.
(Ryu) “Hi Rai.”
(Rai) “Howdy Ryu.”
Ryu and Aura get settled down at the table and Rai gets food out and ready. He sets the food down on the table, then heads back to the refrigerator for a few bottles of tea and sets those down on the table as well. With everything out and ready, Rai takes his seat next to Aura and across from Ryu. Both Ryu and Aura start talking to Rai, but Rai seems to only say a few things.
(Rai) “Sorry, I guess I don’t know how to keep a conversation going.”
(Aura) “It’s alright. Nobody’s perfect and you’re no exception. We just need to eat dinner with you more often, right Ryu?”
(Ryu) “That’s right. How about again tomorrow night?”
(Rai) “Uhh…”
(Aura) “I’ll answer for him: no. He needs us around every once in awhile, not every night.”
(Ryu) “Okay. Just thought I’d try.”
The meal went on with Rai saying a few things every once in awhile and Aura or Ryu replying. Rai seemed a little more joyful than earlier, and everything went along smoothly. You walked out towards the door with your half-eaten berry in hand. You look out at the trio, from behind the doorway, eating together and loneliness hits you. Enviously watching three friends sit and chat, no matter how social or antisocial the individuals are. You wanted to rush out there and join them, but you knew it would not be the same with you there. Sighing, you walk back to table and sit underneath it.
(you) (thinking to yourself) “Wish my friends were here. We would end up looking something like that. In a new world without many people you know sure does get lonely quick. At least I got Rai here with me. We may have just met, but he seems like a friend I knew from ages ago. I guess even though I don’t have my friends here, I will always have Rai to hang out with. (chuckling) There, the first step to thinking positively.”
You look out at them again and they have gotten up from the table.
(Rai) “Anybody want to play?”
(Aura) “You’re on.”
Rai turns the television and the game system on. Aura picks up another controller and sits on the couch along with Rai, leaving Ryu on one of the recliners. You finish eating your berry and pour a capful of water. You sip the water and look around for something to do other than be jealous. You notice Rai’s sketchpad and decide to look at those Latios and Latias drawings. You try pulling and pushing from any angle, but it was just too massive. You give up and walk out of the bag, hoping for a new activity to arise. Nothing else seemed accomplishable, so you walked towards the door, just in time to see Aura and Ryu leaving.
(Ryu) “Bye Rai.”
(Rai) “Later Ryu.”
(Aura) “Are you all right now?”
(Rai) “Thanks to you, yes.”
(Aura) “Good, see you tomorrow.”
(Rai) “See you tomorrow and thanks.”
(Aura) “Anytime Rai.”
112222121121112121221.title: We're Here For You Rai

1122221211211121212212.content:
With that, the brothers were off on their way home. You look out and notice time really flies, because it was already dark out. Rai walked around, shutting off all the lights and walked back into his room. He looks down at you and drops a hand to pick you up. You step up and he walks over to the table, sets you down on the surface, and reaches under the table to grab the water bottle. He caps it and sets it on the table with you. Rai then walks over to his bed and sits on it, staring at you.
(Rai) “Well that was fun”
(you) “It sure looked that way”
(Rai) “Well, I guess I owe you two apologies; one for school today and one for just now.”
(you) “I accept the one for school, but you don’t need to apologize for just now. The deal was I stay hidden, and sometimes that means I’m gonna miss out. So what happened at school? I mean I heard why you got mad, but you seemed unbelievably irritated.
(Rai) “Well those girls always laugh at me and today I guess with you there, I had to show I had power over someone, even if they didn’t see it.”
(you) “Told you I was pathetic.”
(Rai) “Oh come on I didn’t mean it like that. I was angry and wasn’t thinking straight. Sorry.”
(you) “I accept, I just was proving the point.”
Rai just shakes his head and shuts the light off. He lays down and while he is awake, you ask a question that had been eating you since you got home.
(you) “Hey Rai?”
(Rai) “Yeah?”
(you) “Would you ever intentionally hurt me?”
You hear him rapidly sit up and turn on the light.
(Rai) “What?”
(you) “Would you ever intentionally hurt me?”
(Rai) “No. What made you ask that? I’ve not hurt you yet, have I?”
(you) “Well today a pencil hit me, but that was during your rage”
(Rai) “Oh, sorry.”
(you) “It’s alright, but the reason I ask was because I had a nightmare that involved the both of us.”
(Rai) (curiously) “Could you tell me about it?”
(you) “As long as you don’t make fun of me or make a fist.”
(Rai) (puzzled) “I promise.”
You took a few breaths and prepared yourself to relive the nightmare. You then started at the beginning and went on to tell about him beating the life out of you. Throughout the story, you would occasionally look up see Rai with a shocked, yet curious face. You end on the note of the hyper beam and he seems unsatisfied.
(Rai) “So what happened after that?”
(you) “ I woke up and ran to your room, just before you started beating on your walls.”
(Rai) “And that just made it worse, right?”
(you) “Yep.”
(Rai) “Oh boy. I’m just surprised that after all that you’re still talking to me.”
(you) “It was pretty scary, but I thought about the old you and hoped you wouldn’t do that.”
(Rai) “I promise I won’t. We should be getting to sleep. Sleep well and if you have any nightmares, don’t be afraid to wake me up and discuss them.”
(you) “No offense, but I’m not afraid of what you will do if I woke you up. It’s the trying to wake you up part that scares me.”
(Rai) “Oh… that is a good point. Here, (opens the bottle and pours it in the cap) splash me with this and that oughta do the trick.”
(you) “Okay, if you say so. Thanks and see you in the morning.”
(Rai) “Anytime and remember, early wake up tomorrow. See you then.”
He reaches over and shuts the light off. You lay awake for a little while and, with a grin, drift off to sleep.
1122221211211121212212.title: One Day Down

choices: You wake up in Rai's cave
You wake up in the school
11222212112111212122121.content:
You woke up the next morning to an entire hand rolling you a bit. You get up and see Rai staring down at you. You felt a little groggy, but you always felt a little groggy, but that never seemed to stop you before. He smiles down at you and you stand up and stretch.
(Rai) “Morning James.”
(you) “Good morning Rai.”
(Rai) “You didn’t splash me last night, so I assume you were alright.”
(you) “Yeah, nothing wrong. How about you?”
(Rai) “I slept great. Well I woke you up a little earlier so we could get to the river before Aura sees us and we could get some breakfast.”
(you) “That sounds great. Thanks.”
(Rai) “No problem. Well let’s get going.”
He reaches out his hand and you step on, but drop to a knee because you weren’t feeling too stable. Rai slowly walks down to the river and sets you down by it. You and Rai were in perfect sync as you both crouch down and splash water on your faces and shook it off. Rai’s eyes snapped open. He stood up and gave his cry, booming all over the mountain. You liked everything about it except for how loud it was, and decided to try and counter it with a shout of your own. He stops and looks down at you, puzzled.
(Rai) “What are you doing?”
(you) “Well since I’m awake this time, I thought I would try and beat you with a good morning cry of my own. What’d you think?”
(Rai) “I don’t mean to be a dream crusher, but you lost without a doubt.”
(you) (snapping) “Darn, and I thought I had you beat by a mile.”
Rai just chuckled and reached a hand out. You climbed up and he walked back to his cave, then to the table. He set you down, then walked over to the fridge and grabbed breakfast. Breakfast consisted of what looked to be a rawst berry and milk. He poured some milk in a lid and set the berry in front of you. You look at his little pile of berries and hearty glass of milk. You start eating a little before he does and soon had finished everything. He finished a little before you, but you were full and he probably wasn’t even close. You watch as he goes to his room, then returns with his bag. He looks around through his bag, but seems unsatisfied at finding nothing.
(Rai) “You didn’t draw last night. Then how did you keep yourself entertained?”
(you) “Well I wanted to look at your Latios and Latias drawings since I didn’t get to see them at lunch, but I couldn’t move the sketchpad nor open it.”
(Rai) “I’ll show you them after school today, deal?”
(you) “Deal.”
(Rai) Well let’s be off to school then.”
He threw the bag over his shoulder and set you inside. He shut the flap and was off to school. A little while later, you arrive at school and pretty much repeat yesterday morning: Rai goes to his locker and gets his stuff, teachers and students saying hi, and you tottering around the bag as students walked by. This time was different though, during the first class, both Aura and Jet were there, and Jet had a bandana on. You slept through every morning class, except art, which you once again failed to learn any new drawing techniques. At lunch, Rai woke you up and you climb up to his shoulder to eat your lunch. The two of you both enjoy your lunch, until those girls from yesterday start laughing at Rai again.
(you) (nervous) “It’s okay, just stay calm.”
(Rai) (drops his head, then whispers) “It’s alright, I’m fine. After you explained that nightmare and told me how afraid you were, I realize that nobody gains anything by me getting angry, so relax.”
(you) (sighing in relief) “Good, had me a little nervous there. Do you think you could get me a little tea, please?”
Rai picks the bottle up and drinks a little, but then “accidentally” slips it from his mouth and pours just a little your way. Most of it landed in your mouth, but the rest splashed your face.
(you) “Are you sure you’re not trying to prove you have power over me again?”
(Rai) “No. The reason I did it like that was because any other way would have looked suspicious.”
(you) “Ah, touché.”
Rai finished his lunch and so did you. You look around for anyone, then run down Rai to get to the bag. He just shakes his head and chuckles. He stands up, shuts the bag, and walks to class since the bell just rang. You sleep through all of the classes again and you wake up shortly after the final bell has rung. You move to the top of the bag and look out as the entire hallway is empty, except for the two of you and an ariados. You figured he was just another student, but as he got close to Rai, you noticed Rai seemed to get a little tense.
(Rai) “What do you want Jared?”
(Jared) “You know what I want.”
(Rai) “No, I really don’t.”
(Jared) “I know you have a commit child, so hand him over!”
(Rai) “I really don’t know what you are talking about.”
(Jared) “So you wanna play dumb, huh? Fine. Then after I destroy you, he will be mine!”
Jared charges at Rai and Rai throws his bag aside and the two fight each other. You were thrown around, but luckily landed safely after the bag hit the floor. You could look out of the bag and watch the two fight, Rai scoring a hit, then Jared landing one, but you didn’t want to see Rai take too many hits, so you step back from the opening and sit down and think.
(you) (thinking) “How did he know I was here? And why did he call me a commit child?
Better yet, what is a commit child? I wonder if Rai knows. (sighing) I hope he wins. I don’t think all would be well if Jared wins. I just wish there was something I could do. Rai’s fighting for me out there and all I’m doing is sitting here watching him like it’s all just a movie.”
You crawl back towards the opening, frustrated, and all you see is Rai moving slowly and taking multiple hits. He eventually backed out of sight and a large thud could be heard and felt.
(Jared) (tired) “Now hand him over!”
(Rai) (near fainting) “N-n-never. I’ll never l-let you t-take him.”
(Jared) “Very well then, weakling.”
Jared looked like he was about to prepare another attack, one to finish Rai off. You were afraid to lose Rai, because in your eyes, he was just a huge, steel brother. Without second thoughts or regrets, you ran out of the bag towards the ariados. The ariados stopped whatever attack it had prepared and now focused on you.
(Rai) (weakly saying) “Nooo!”
(Jared) (exhausted) “That’s right, come to me!”
(you) (filled with hatred) “Oh I’ll come to you alright. Just with a little surprise!”
You ran full force towards him, never looking back at your fallen comrade Rai. You just ran with both fists clenched tight. You were near him and you closed your eyes. You felt him use String Shot, but it didn’t affect you at all. You heard him gasp, but somehow it didn’t affect you at all. You heard him gasp, but all you felt was a thirst for vengeance and a strange, growing sense of solidity. You jump and with all your might, throw an uppercut. You jumped in air and after what felt like minutes, you felt your fist connect with the underside of his head. You expected to not do much damage, but after you landed, you opened your eyes to see Jared a few inches back from where he was, upside down. You walk over to him and noticed he’s fainted. You walk back towards Rai and notice he’s got a used potion in his hands. He puts it back in his bag and notices you walking towards him.
(Rai) “How did you do that?!”
(you) (breathing heavily) “I really don’t kno…”
All of sudden you felt completely exhausted and collapsed. Everything started to go black and the last thing you recall was hearing Rai.
(Rai) “JAMES!!”
Things finally faded out and all was black and silent.
11222212112111212122121.title: Another Day, Another Battle

112222121121112121221211.content:
You slowly woke up from fainting and everything seemed blurry. You rubbed your eyes and noticed you were back in Rai’s cave. Sitting up and looking around, you notice Rai is nowhere in sight and you start to wonder where he could be. Unsure of what happened, you stand up and see that you were laying on cloths on the kitchen table. You stood there motionless and silent until you heard someone mumbling. It came from Rai’s room and you climb down the table. Walking as stealthily as possible, you make your way to Rai’s room and peer around the doorway. Rai was mumbling as he sat on the edge of his. He had his head down and didn’t move an inch. You walk over to him and look up at his face. He looks unhappy, but doesn’t notice you at all.
(you) “Hey Rai.”
(Rai) (trance-like state) “James is hurt because of me. I should have protected him at all costs.”
(you) “Hey, I’m fine. See?”
(Rai) “He trusted me to protect him, but I failed.”
(you) “Rai, I’m perfectly fine. You haven’t failed yet.”
Rai just sat there, motionless, and started to cry with a mixture of sadness and anger. You just watched and stepped back a bit. You looked at yourself, then pinched yourself in order to be sure you weren’t dead or something. You felt the pinch and just looked up at Rai.
(you) “Rai it’s alright. Rai. Rai. RAI!!!!”
He remained motionless. Unsure of what else to do, you felt you had no choice other than try and shake him for attention. You walk over to his leg and shake it, first soft, then progressively rougher. You step and think of something when you trip over a pebble. You pick it up and throw it as hard as you can at Rai’s face. It hits his lower jaw, but doesn’t seem to have done anything. You all of a sudden feel weak, not physically, but more because anything you tried failed. With all but one idea gone, you decide to put it effect no matter how useless: hit Rai until he noticed you. With all the anger coursing through you, you cocked your arm back, shouted to Rai one last time, and threw your punch. But before your fist connected with Rai’s foot, you felt a strange sensation. It felt familiar: it was the same sensation you had before you hit Jared back at school. You felt solid and undefeatable. Your fist finally hit and the pain you had expected to follow never came. Rather, your fist stayed locked at Rai’s foot and even made the foot move a few inches. You fell to a knee and started to breathe heavily due to the power you put in the punch. Rai almost instantaneously snapped back to life and looked around. He notices you on the ground near his foot and gasps. You look up to meet his surprised expression.
(you) (still breathing heavily) “It’s.. nice to see.. you awake and well. And.. just so you know.. I’m perfectly fine.. because of you.”
(Rai) “But you passed out in the school because I let Jared take me down. And you got hurt because of that.”
(you) “Maybe, but without you there, I never could have fought him off alone. Plus, you took me back here to your home to recover. So all is well and good.”
(Rai) “If you say you’re fine then I guess your fine. Ok, so I got a few questions, but one at a time. One how did you wake me up? When I’m in a trance stage like that, it’s almost impossible to wake me up.”
(you) “Yeah I noticed how hard it is. I tried a bunch of different things, but I finally punched your foot and you woke up.”
(Rai) (puzzled) “Huh, that’s strange, no offense, but you don’t seem strong enough to wake me up with a punch.”
(you) “It’s alright, I know what you’re saying and I agree, but I did it to Jared and now to you.”
(Rai) “Speaking of Jared, I noticed something strange about you when you hit him. While you were running over to him, you looked like you were made of metal. How did you do that?”
(you) “What? But I can’t change to being made of metal. Are you sure you’re alright?”
(Rai) “I used potions before we left to come back here and I know that’s what I saw.”
(you) “Well I can’t answer your question because I honestly don’t have a clue as to what you are talking about. The only thing I know that happened was I closed my eyes, I felt different, then hit Jared.”
(Rai) “I believe you, even though it’s hard to believe. Final questions: what did Jared mean when he said you were a commit child?”
(you) “Oh boy, well I hate to sound stupid, but I don’t have an answer for that question. I was going to ask you about the commit child thing.”
(Rai) “Dang, no answers for the questions I’d like answered.”
(you) “Sorry”
(Rai) It’s alright, I was just hoping you knew. I wish somebody could tell me about the commit child thing without bringing harm to either of us.”
(you) “Yeah.”
(???) “I can tell you and I’m not going to hurt either of you.”
Both you and Rai turn to look at the doorway to his room and saw…
112222121121112121221211.title: Down, But Not Out

choices: You wake up in the middle of the night
Rai wakes you up the next morning
1122221211211121212212111.content:
Both you and Rai were surprised as Mew was floating in front of you. She floated closer to you, but you backed off a little.
(Rai) “H-hello miss Mew.”
(Mew) “Hi. Just call me Mew. What’s your name?”
(Rai) “I’m Rai and this (pointing at you) is James.”
(Mew) “Hi James.”
(you) “H-h-h-hi”
(Mew) “What’s the matter? Meowth got your tongue?”
(Rai) “It’s just that neither of us really talk much to others. You’re the first person he’s met other than me.”
(Mew) “Aww. It’s okay, I won’t hurt you.”
She comes real close to you and, in response; you cower a bit and close your eyes. You open your eyes once you feel your head being gently petted.
(Mew) “See that’s not so bad, is it?”
(you) “I guess not. Thank you.”
See just smiles and floats back, looping every once and awhile.
(Rai) “I don’t mean to be rude, but you said you could answer my question.”
(Mew) “You asked about the commit children. Lucky you, I have the answer.”
(Rai) “Awesome, but you said commit children, so there’s more than one?”
(Mew) “Yes. If you’ll listen to my story, I can explain.”
(Rai) “I’ll listen, how about you James?”
You just nod and climb up Rai to sit on his shoulder so Mew was really only talking in one direction rather than two.
(Mew) “Well, to make sense, I have to tell you the history behind the commit children. Around 400 years ago, a race known as the night crawlers waged war against the island. Day and night, they would come to the island, destroying everything in sight and leaving everyone amongst ruins and chaos. Just when we neared complete destruction and all hope seemed lost, 9 heroes emerged to fight the monsters. These heroes were the Heroes of Joy, Sorrow, Rage, Peace, Courage, Wisdom, Willpower, Light, and Darkness. All pokemon who saw them fight were envious, envious of their strengths and abilities, ones nobody except the heroes possessed. Eventually all the monsters were slain, for a time, and peace returned to Emerald Island. Yet, the monsters would show up now and then, and the heroes were there to defeat them. Then one day a monster, larger than any night crawler, came to the island. The monster became known as the destroyer, due to the fact that the island would cease to exist with one swing of its claw. The 9 heroes confronted the monster in battle, but it was too strong for them to defeat. Finally, with hope dwindling, the heroes combined themselves into one and defeated the monster. Though the monster was not physically there, an essence of the monster remained. The heroes took the essence to a secret island and sealed it away behind an indestructible barrier. With the world at peace once again, the heroes left, never to return. But before they left, they sent an essence of themselves to another dimension to seek out a successor. The successors of these heroes are known as Commit Children and have the hero’s amazing powers. The heroes also had a color that identified which commit child inherited which hero’s powers. Red: the Hero of Rage. Blue: the Hero of Sorrow. Green: the Hero of Peace. Yellow: the Hero of Joy. Black: the Hero of Darkness. White: the Hero of Light. Grey: the Hero of Willpower. Purple: the Hero of Wisdom. And Orange: the Hero of Courage. We have never needed to call upon them because of the peace… until now.”
Mew finished and just floated in one place before you opened your mouth.
(you) “So I am a commit child?”
(Mew) “Yep.”
(you) “Are you sure? I don’t think I have what it takes.”
(Mew) “Of course you have what it takes. Otherwise, you wouldn’t be here.”
(you) “I guess, if you say so.”
(Mew) “You’ll be fine, trust me. Any more questions?”
(Rai) “Yeah. How does James use these powers?”
(Mew) “I wish I could answer that, but I’m not really sure. I guess he is going to either need help from the Hero of Willpower or figure it out on his own. Sorry I couldn’t answer that.”
(Rai) “It’s alright. Thanks Mew.”
(you) “Yes. Thanks a lot.”
(Mew) “Anytime. See you guys later.”
With that Mew was vanished and you and Rai sat there, thinking about your situation.
(Rai) “So that’s what a commit child is. Great, you’re so important and I have to try and protect you. I’m gonna screw it up.”
(you) “No you won’t. You’ve done great so far.”
(Rai) “And what about at school? You passed out because I couldn’t beat Jared.”
(you) “The only reason I passed out is because I ran out of the bag and I punched Jared. You didn’t mess anything up. So what, he got you once. As far as I’m concerned, I wouldn’t have beaten him without your help weakening him.”
Rai just sat there and thought about the whole commit child thing, then a thought crossed his mind.
(Rai) “Mew said there were 9 heroes, right? That means there are 8 others, excluding you.”
You gave him a look that showed you understood what he meant and the two of you talked about it, until your stomach growled.
(you) “I’m kind of hungry.”
(Rai) “So am I. Let’s go get some food.”
He walks in to the kitchen, with you on his shoulder, and puts you down on the table, and makes his way to the refrigerator. He grabs the usual and spreads out both his meal and yours. Before long, you both finished and made your way back to the bedroom. He sets you down on the table ad he lays down in his bed. With an exchange of goodnights, you both fall asleep.
1122221211211121212212111.title: The 9 Heroes

choices: You wake up again in the middle of the night
You wake up the next morning
11222212112111212122121111.content:
You had just fallen asleep when you started to dream of everyone back home. You had said hi to each person and they each replied back with a hello. You stood in your dream with everybody before you woke up. You looked out the doorway, expecting to see sunlight. All you saw was moonlight and you laid back down. Sleep didn’t come as easily this time. You eventually looked over at a sleeping Rai, then climbed down the table. You walk out of the cave without a care in the world and stop when you got to the river. You sat down by the waters edge and just sat down, looking at the beautiful reflection of the moon on the crystal clear water.
(you) (thinking to yourself) “Beautiful night tonight. Let’s hope no one else is awake to come out and admire it. Of course if they do, I can always use these powers for my defense. These powers… why do I have them? This “Hero of Willpower” must have made a mistake and picked me instead. Yea because I can’t be the true successor, I’m not strong enough, nor good enough to wield them. Maybe tomorrow I’ll wake up to find out I’ve just been dreaming. Just one crazy, long…realistic dream. Who am I kidding, everything here is real. This world, Rai, these powers, everything. I just hope I can fill the hero’s shoes and accomplish what I need to. I wonder if all the other commit children are like me. Hope I don’t let them down either, whoever they are. Great. between them and Rai, I’ve got so much to live up to. Knowing my luck, they’ll think I’m a stuck up jerk if we ever meet each other. So much stuff in so little time. Well tomorrow is a new day, maybe it’ll be a good day. Tomorrow, I work on mastering these powers and helping Rai rather than slowing him down. Probably should be getting to bed.”
You sat outside a little longer, occasionally reaching in for a little drink. Finally, you got up and went back to the cave. You walked in to Rai’s room and climbed back on the table. You laid in bed, but sat back up when Rai said something. You looked over at him, but all he did was mumble as he tossed and turned. You breathe out a deep breath and lay back down.
(you) (somewhat quietly) “Rai, I will help as much as I can and try not to let you down. I promise I will do my best and together, we will both be somebodies. Thank you Rai, you’re an awesome friend, even though you’re more like a brother to me. Good night and again, thank you.”
You fell back to sleep and slept well until…
11222212112111212122121111.title: In the midst of night

112222121121112121221211112.content:
You woke up the next morning and looked over to see Rai still sleeping. You got off your cloth bed and stretched. You thought about your powers and decided to see if you still had them. Not wanting to damage anything, you make a fist and focus on it becoming solid. That sensation flowed through you again and soon your hand looked metallic. You broke your concentration and the feeling as well as the metallic look went away, leaving your hand normal. You stood there, unsure of why you hadn’t passed out yet. You decided it was because of how little you did it. You heard something stirring and looked over to see Rai getting up.
(you) “Morning Rai.”
(Rai) “Whoa you’re up already.”
(you) “I just got up.”
(Rai) “Ah, I see. So what are you going to do since you have those powers?”
(you) “Stay with you and practice on mastering my powers while I’m in your bag.”
(Rai) “Really? Even with your powers, you’re gonna stick with me?”
(you) “Yep. I wouldn’t be alive without you and I think we make a great team. Of course if you want me to leave then…
(Rai) “No. It’d be great if you stayed. Thanks.”
(you) “Right back at ya.”
Rai got out of bed and opened a hand for you to climb on. You reluctantly step up and the two of you head to the river. Both of you splash water on your faces and open your eyes. You waited for Rai to shout, but it never came. He reached out a hand and you step on. You wanted to ask Rai what’s the matter, but didn’t for no particular reason. He got breakfast ready and set it down on the table. You were about to bite into your berry when you stopped and looked at him.
(you) “Hey Rai.”
(Rai) “Yeah?”
(you) “I hope you don’t me asking, but what’s the matter?”
(Rai) “Hm?”
(you) “Well every morning since I’ve been here, you go to the river, shout, then come back. But this morning you didn’t and that kinda makes me concerned.”
(Rai) “Well last night I had a dream that with your new powers, you didn’t need me and you left. I woke up and looked over at your bed and you were gone, so I thought you had left. Then when you were here this morning, I wasn’t and I’m still not sure what to think.”
(you) “Oh, I see. Just so you know, I don’t plan on leaving unless there’s a good enough reason. I left last night to go and think about all that’s happened so far. I was just standing down by the river, thinking about my world, and this world. Besides I think we’re almost brothers, so I couldn’t leave.”
(Rai) “Cool. Well thanks.”
Both of you finish your breakfast, but each a little more cheerful than before. Soon, Rai has his bag over his shoulder and you slide in. He makes his way to school and the morning repeats itself again. Later in the classroom you wait for the kids to start piling in and shaking you around. Then it hit you, they can’t shake you if you’re made of metal. You wait for the last moment and let that solid feeling come over. The kids walk by, but you didn’t move at all. You let go after they had all passed and soon you return to normal. But not long afterwards, you pass out again. Time passes by and you wake up, still in the same class. Shaking it off, you stand up and think of what else you can work on. Then for, some odd reason you feel tired and since you already did a bit of training, you give in and fall asleep. You start dreaming about…
112222121121112121221211112.title: A Stong Start

1122221211211121212212111121.content:
You were dreaming you were in a cave. You looked around and realized it was Rai’s cave. You were unsure of how you got there or why you were normal sized. Regardless, you walk out and see nothing but water around you. Unsure of what happened to the rest of Emerald Island, you look towards the mountain’s peak. Then you hear a “hello” come from behind and you turn around. You see a grey floating flame floating where you heard the voice.
(you) “Hi and who are you?”
(grey flame) “I am the spirit of the Grey Hero.”
(you) “So… you’re the Hero of Willpower?”
(grey flame) “The essence of him, but yes.”
(you) “So why me? I can’t possibly be of help or be who you need.”
(essence) “On the contrary, you are exactly whom I seek.”
(you) “But why? What makes me better than anyone else? Are you sure you didn’t mess up?”
(essence) “I made no mistake in picking you. You are perfect for the job, whether you believe it or not. The reason I picked you is… maybe it would help if I showed you, then explained.”
The mountain begins to shake and steel ‘I’ beams pop out at various places. Then rocks begin to tumble down towards the beams. They all begin to disintegrate either at the two flat parts of the “I” or the middle part. All the rocks hit the partially destroyed beams and break apart, and the bars are left bent or in pieces.
(essence) “The reason I chose you is because of your willpower. The beams up there represent peoples’ wills. The two flat pieces represent their determination to help others with their goals and the center part represents the determination for their own goals. The rocks represent obstacles. As you can see, every beam had a part disintegrate, representing them either losing sight of their goals or losing caring for others’ goals. With the loss of one part, all the other goals suffered because they lost sight of a single goal, either their own or somebody else’s. But you, (one beam pops out alone and a rock rolls towards it) you remain solid and keep everyone’s goals in your mind, even your own. (the rock hits the beam and the beam doesn’t move) Even though you have obstacles, some more challenging than others, you stay strong and remain determined to accomplish both yours and others’ goals. (lone steel beam bends in crazy or impossible ways) Sometimes you also bend to others needs, even if it put your goals at stake. You still keep them all in your mind and never lose sight of them. (both rocks and other beams come flying towards the single beam and a cloud of dust forms) And even though once and while these obstacles bring you down, whether other people or more natural problems, (the cloud clears and the beam is bent all the way down, then slowly returns perfectly upright) you always come back, determined to finish the task at hand, no matter how much you’re brought down. You never lose sight of the goals and never give in until they’re done. That is why I chose you.”
(you) “I understand, but I still don’t think I’m the one you need. There must be others who are better than me”
(essence) “I know it’s hard to believe and I don’t question your doubt, but you are my successor. I’ve made no mistake in choosing you. You must believe me. Believe in yourself more. You are more than capable of wielding my powers and bearing my burden.”
The flame starts to brighten, then slowly dulls.
(essence) “Just believe in yourself. I know you will be great.”
(you) “I believe you and thank you.”
The flame almost had a smile before it completely faded out, leaving you on the mountain alone. You expected this be the part where you wake up, but you were still there. You went up to the lone beam still standing and touched it. It seemed solid, yet almost seemed to move when you touched it. You imagined it bending all the way down and then, as if on queue, it did. A little puzzled, you imagined it standing straight up and it did. You kept thinking of it moving in various ways, and whatever you thought, it did. You decided that when you woke up, you had to try this out. You walk back down to “Rai’s” cave and looked around at it. It was pretty nice when you were the size it was meant for. You try everything in Rai’s cave, from his bed to the water, then you saw his TV and game system. “Yes” you said to yourself and turned on both the system and the TV. But then you woke up in…
1122221211211121212212111121.title: The Hero of Willpower

11222212112111212122121111211.content:
You woke up and looked around, seeing only the open end of the bag and a berry. You slowly walk towards the berry, and look out of the bag, but don’t see Rai anywhere. You peek around the side of the bag and see Rai talking to some other pokemon. You weren’t sure what they were talking about, but by the look on Rai’s face, it wasn’t good. Then out of nowhere, berries are getting launched towards Rai by those same pokemon that were talking to him. They splash all over him and some of the juice gets in his eyes. You watch as he struggles to wipe it out, but can’t as the other berries stop him from doing so. Anger swells within and swiftly courses through your veins. Then memories of these kinds of things happening to you re-emerge and fueled your rage. Eventually deciding this was complete and utter madness, you looked for a way to help him without being seen. You noticed everyone throwing something was sitting on metal chairs. Feeling the need for payback and some more practice with your powers, you step out of the bag, staying close to it so you remain hidden, and close your eyes. You focus on the chairs melting beneath them, pooling together, and forming a creature. You made the monster similar to a werewolf, as tall as Rai, made entirely of metal, and with spikes extruding from its back. You open your eyes for a second to see this creation form, then close your eyes to take control of it. Then, rather than just see the creature, you feel like you are the creature. Your sight becomes what it would see, you feel what it would feel, and for however long you could last, this monster and you were one. A few screams and gasps are heard, but you stay focused on the task at hand. You glare down at Rai’s aggressors. Looks of fear cross their faces, but they otherwise remain motionless.
(Purugly) “W-w-who are you and wh-where did you come from?”
(you/creature) “I have no name. I was forged from the pain and anguish of those you’ve harmed. Now their marks have left me a form which cannot be destroyed, like the scars you’ve inflicted on their mental minds or their bodies.”
(Houndoom) “Indestrucible? Yeah right.”
Houndooom readies a fireball and fires it at you. It hits your abdominal region. Surprisingly, you don’t feel any pain, but you notice it melted part of your creation. Soon, the metal melts back and fixes your hole like there was never one there. Everybody gasps again and stands there, paralyzed with fear. You just grin, but it was soon replaced by a stern face.
(you/creature) “As you can see, I am unharmed. Now I offer you a warning: do not harm this Aggron or anyone else anymore, lest you wish to be harmed yourselves.”
(Houndoom) “Talk is cheap!”
He readies another fireball and lets it go. This time it hits your face. Your face amazingly didn’t melt, but your blood was brought to an even higher boil. Rather than just say something and have them not listen, you remembered that actions speak louder than words. You ready a fist and throw it at the Houndoom’s chest. He gets sent flying back and lands on the ground, unconscious. Everybody in the lunch area turned to see him lying there. You look out amongst all the pokemon, secretly surprised to see so many different kinds, even though they weren’t truly seeing you. They quickly went back to eating lunch and tried hard not to look. You turned your eyes back to your intended audience.
(you/creature) “I said it once and made an example. Now I will repeat myself: Do not harm anybody anymore or you will end up like him. Farewell. (Turn around to Rai) Do not allow them to harm you anymore. Let them fear you, not the other way around.”
They all nod and try to say goodbye, but are still too afraid to utter a sound. Even Rai was afraid, even though you were about equal in strength as he was. Thinking you are about to pass out from exhaustion, you melt the creature back into the chairs they originally were, walk back in the bag, and pick up the berry. You had just taken a bite out of it when things started to go black. You drop the berry and fall on your side. The last thing you remember thinking was that your mission had been accomplished and you did have the ability to warp other metals. You passed out and later woke up…
11222212112111212122121111211.title: Payback

112222121121112121221211112111.content:
You slowly woke up and looked around. You noticed your unfinished lunch was on top of you and Rai was back in class. You picked the berry up and slowly ate it. You couldn’t tell what they were talking about in class, but you really didn’t care. After finishing the berry, you start thinking about how to train next and a thought crossed your mind: If you could become made of metal and could manipulate metal, could you manipulate your body to change shape? You start to turn your hand to steel, then imagine it being a hammer. It slowly gains the head and claw. You change it into a mace and then a sword. Finally, you change your hand back to normal and relax. Sitting there, you start to wonder about all the other commit children.
(you) “I wonder who all the other commit children are. I hope they’re people I know or at least people I can get along with. All of us humans, in a world bigger than any of us, supposed to stop some evil force. Impossible. Mew said all nine of us have a power only for us and that they were inherited from the 9 Heroes. They were normal sized pokemon, not micro humans.”
You thought you heard the Hero of Willpower say something and you feel the chills. You decided it was time to keep working on mastering your powers.

The rest of the day went smoothly and soon, school was out. Rai was at his locker and you were peeking out of the bag. Nobody was there except you, Rai, and… Aura! You duck back in and think of what you can do to stay secret. You couldn’t outrun him and nowhere was safe to hide. You began to panic when you started to feel strange, yet familiar. You remember you can change your shape. You turn to complete metal and think of a form you can take on that arouses the least suspicions. The only one that came to mind was your creation from lunch and soon, the monster is once again a part of you and you a part of him. You stand in a position that resembled an action figure. You stay perfectly still as Aura and Rai begin to talk.
(Aura) “Hey Rai.”
(Rai) “Hi Aura.”
(Aura) “How’s it going?”
(Rai) “Alright. How about you?”
(Aura) “Great. Can I ask you two questions?”
(Rai) “Fire away.”
(Aura) “Well I wanted to know if you wanted to come over for dinner. I’m having dinner with some other friends and thought maybe you’d like to join.”
(Rai) (depressed) “Not tonight, okay?”
(Aura) “Yeah it’s alright. Anytime you want to come over or talk, just come see me.”
(Rai) “Alright, thanks. Didn’t you say you had two questions?”
(Aura) “Yes. I hope you don’t mind me asking, but what’s hiding in your bag?”
(Rai) “W-what are you talking about?”
(Aura) “Rai, I’ve been seeing an aura other than yours all day and it’s been coming from your bag. You can show me Rai, I won’t hurt it.”
(Rai) (defeated) “Okay.”
Rai opens the bag and starts searching through it. He keeps looking until he sees you, but looks surprised when he notices your form. Nonetheless, he picks you up and hands you over to Aura. Aura looks surprised as he examines you. You remain frozen and without a single emotion, as this would change your aura.
(Aura) “Rai, this is what you’ve had in your bag all day? It looks just like that thing from lunch. Did you make both of them?”
(Rai) “I didn’t make either of them. I don’t know how this got in my bag.”
(Aura) “Rai…”
(Rai) “Aura, I swear I didn’t. You’ve got to believe me. I had juice in my eyes during lunch and when I could see again, the monster had already taken out Marcus [the Houndoom]. I don’t even know what it’s is supposed to be.”
Aura just looked at him, unconvinced, and, with you still in paw, raised his other paw and closed his eyes. He sat there for a few seconds, then opened his eyes and lowered his paw.
(Aura) “Forgive me for not believing you. It just seemed too coincidental.”
(Rai) “It’s okay. This statue and that monster do look alike, and I’ve got the statue in my bag.”
(Aura) “It’s good to hear somebody or something took vengeance for you. So you’re okay, right?”
(Rai) “Yeah, I’m fine and I guess it’s great for that lunch incident. But what I don’t understand is why it showed up now or why it said something about being formed from pain and anguish.”
(Aura) “That does seem intriguing. Well see you tomorrow Rai and here’s your thing back. Again I’m sorry.”
(Rai) “ I forgive you Aura. Thank you and farewell for now.”
Aura left, leaving Rai looking at you, unsure of what you were or where ‘you’ were at. He sets you back down in the bag and sets off for home. When he gets home, he empties the bag on the table you hit the table somewhat hard. He sifted through everything all while calling your name. Eventually you move around and stand up, leaving him staring at you.
(you) “Yes?”
(Rai) “J-James?”
(you) (returning back to normal) “It is indeed James.”
(Rai) “But how?”
(you) “Well I decided to do some experimenting with my powers and found I can change my metal self as well as other metal objects.”
(Rai) “Cool, but then that means you were responsible for the monster.”
(you) “Yes I did make the monster. I’m sorry for the trouble between you and Aura. I just didn’t want to be seen.”
(Rai) “I forgive you for me and Aura, but why did you make that monster? It could’ve put you in more danger.”
(you) “I know, but I couldn’t stand by, watching you being berry-bombed and laughed at. So to keep you from getting in trouble, I took the risk and made the monster to protect you.”
(Rai) (stunned) ……Thank you. But I’ve got to ask two questions: One, why were asleep this morning, and two, how are you still awake?”
(you) “Well I felt really tired this morning and I’ve been training, so I guess I’m a little more durable.”
(Rai) “So you can use the advanced technique too.
(you) “Advanced… Technique?”
(Rai) “Yeah, advanced technique. Pokemon are taught how to use it, from taming fire to bending water and so on. I know how to use it, but like most pokemon, I just use them for speical tournaments.”
(you) “So… you can bend metal too?”
(Rai) “Yeah. Here I’ll show you and we can work on it a little bit.”
Rai went over to his cabinet and pulled out two forks. He sets one down in front of you and the other he sets in front of himself. He twists the fork in one way and you copy him. Whatever he did, you imitated. Eventually he makes a human-like form that resembles you. To have a little fun of your own you turn into metal and shift your shape. In a few seconds, the sensation you always get from turning to metal fades and you leave yourself looking like Rai. He just stares, surprised at how much you look like him.
(you) “Sorry, I can deal with two Rai’s but not two James’s.”
(Rai) “That is unbelievable! You look just like me.”
(you) “Thanks. I practiced making forms at lunch today.”
Rai just laughs and heads over to the fridge for dinner. You return to normal and return the forks to their regular shape. He sets out a berry and some tea for you and sets his food down. You both eat in silence and when you’re done, Rai heads over to his game system and TV and turns them both on. He grabs a controller and sits on the couch. You climb down from the table and walk over to the couch and climb on the arm. You sit there awhile and he sits there playing. He looks over at you lot, but says nothing.
(you) “We’re both still antisocial.”
(Rai) (chuckling) “Yep. You wanna play?”
(you) “Play, no. Try, yes.”
He sets the controller down in front of you and you wait to begin your attempt. You run back and forth, hitting all the buttons you could, but it was just too hard and you lost.
(you) Oh. So much for that.”
(Rai) “Good effort, even at the size disadvantage. (looking out of the cave) Well I think it’s time to call it a day. Wouldn’t you agree, Mr. Monster?”
You laugh and begin to turn metal. You change to look like your monster and speak.
(you) “Yes I would Master Rai.”
He just laughs, shaking his head, and opens his hand for you to climb on. You step on and he gets ready for bed. He sets you on table and you return to normal while he lies down.
(you) “Night Rai.”
(Rai) “Night James and thanks.”
(you) (yawning) “Anything for a friend, Rai.”
You both fall asleep, but about half an hour later, you wake up because…
112222121121112121221211112111.title: Practice Makes Perfect

choices: To stay up a little longer
1122221211211121212212111121111.content: You woke up because you heard somebody in the cave. You called out to Rai, but he was deep in sleep and not easily awakened. You let him sleep, but you yourself were determined to find who it is and if necessary, get them out of here, no matter what size they are. You slip down the table and shuffle over to the doorway. You peek around the corner and can barely make out a figure in the moonlight. It appeared to be a Ditto and it was searching for something… or someone. It mumbled to itself, but by the way it was searching through everything, it was looking for you. You wanted to fight it off, but at your size, you wouldn’t win and would probably get captured. He starts opening all the kitchen drawers and you notice it’s about to go for the silverware drawer. You see an opportunity to attack and wait for him to open the drawer. You merge all the forks together and drop this metal mass on top of the Ditto. It didn’t react quickly enough and was crushed beneath the mass. It slimed its way out and searched for its attacker. You stay behind the doorway, out of sight, and make the mass turn into a Ditto-like shape. The real Ditto turns back around and jumps back a little. It moves and you move the mass in the same ways, like a mirror. It stands still for a second and you attack again. This time you make your Ditto throw a punch and it hits the other Ditto in the face. It recoils and starts rubbing its face. You make your Ditto melt into a puddle and circle around this other Ditto. It looks fearfully at the puddle and that’s when your werewolf monster forms from the puddle. It’s smaller than the table, but bigger than the Ditto. It takes the form of your monster and tries to attack. You quickly turn around and the Ditto hits the spikes on your monster’s back. Ditto returns to its regular form and just looks at your monster, tired from fighting. It takes one last look at the monster and runs away as fast as it can. You let it escape and watch it run out of the cave. On the way out, though, it mentions something like “The boss ain’t going to be happy about this!” You assume he had some boss that sent him to find you, probably just like Jared. Unconcerned at the moment, you melt your monster back into forks and sets them back in the drawer. You climb up the counter and barely manage to shut the drawer. You sit there for a minute and decide…
1122221211211121212212111121111.title: Match with a Mirror

11222212112111212122121111211111.content:
You didn’t think you would be able to sleep, so you decided to stay up for a little while. You sat there on the counter, looking out of the cave at the beautiful moonlight. You climb off the counter and stand at the mouth of the cave. All of a sudden, you hear a whoosh of air that, seconds later, blows you back in the cave. You roll and land face up. Something lands on your face, but you move it and take a look around to see what just air tackled you. You see nothing, but hear a girl’s playful giggle.
(you) “Must be hearing things. And what is this thing?”
You stand up, dusting yourself off, and look at what had landed on your face. You hold it out in front of you and see that it is a grey cloak. It had no hood, but it could cover your body completely or halfway. You nod in approval and try it on. It fits perfectly, but as soon as you get it on, a symbol of some sort glows on your back, then fades away. You couldn’t tell what it was, but it didn’t hurt a bit. You move it so it is halfway, but it vanished when you did. You wonder where it went and reach where it should be. It somehow shows up in your grip and you pull it back over your body. It completely shows up again. Curious, you play with pulling it back and forth. It disappears and reappears until you stop. Unsure of what it is or why you have it, you walk down to the river with it draping over you. You hear that laugh again and turn around, once again seeing nothing. Shaking your head, you sit down and try to find your sanity. You watch the river flow and decide to practice a little on your advanced techniques. You notice a metal lump not too far away and get it closer to you. You make throwing knives out of it and toss one in the water. It seems to get absorbed by the water rather than make a splash. Unhappy, you pull your cloak over your head and notice you can see right through it, almost as if it isn’t there. A little startled, you pop your head back out and look at it from the outside. You can’t see through it from the outside, but you can see through it from the inside. You pull it back over your head, make another throwing knife, and throw it at the water. When it hits the water, the water splashes this time. You throw another knife without the cloak over your head, then another with the cloak. The results are different, but show are exactly the same from the first time. Intrigued, you do the same thing with the air, without the cloak, the knife just flies through the air, but when the cloak was over your head, you could see all the air currents and watch the knife move through those air currents.
(you) “So… this cloak helps me see and target things I normally can’t?”
(girl) (giggles) “Yay!”
(you) “ Ah. Wait, who are you and why are you following me?
Before she can answer another gush of wind comes and tumbles you.
(you) “Not again.”
(guy’s voice) “C’mon sis, let’s go.”
(girl’s voice) “Okay. See you later, little guy.”
(you) “Sis? Little guy!? What?!”
Soon the two seemed to leave, but you couldn’t be sure because you couldn’t see anyone.
But then you had the idea of trying out the cloak to see if you could see whoever this duo was. You pull your cloak over you and look around. You didn’t see anyone and you turn to look behind you.
