That’s when you saw two large eyes not even five feet away looking at you. You recognize the faces but have a hard time admitting they’re there or that the one just scared you half to death. For who stood or rather floated in front of you were Latios and Latias.
(you) “AHH!” (fall backwards and start breathing heavy)
(Latios) “Sis, I think you overdid it. You okay?”
(Latias) “Sorry.” (offering you help up)
(you) “I think so. (getting up) Thank you.”
You stood there, stunned that these two legends were right in front of you. You wanted to say something, but between your shock, fear, and antisocialism, no words came out of your mouth.
(Latias) “Hey, are you ok?”
(Latios) “I think he’s more scared than hurt.”
(you) (almost whispering) “I’m a little bit of everything.”
(Latias) “Little bit of everything? What do you mean?”
(you) “Well I don’t talk much and I’m surprised to see you two, but you did scare me pretty badly.”
(Latios) “So you’re quiet. That’s alright, nobody’s perfect. I can understand being surprised. It’s not everyday you see legendary pokemon. And it’s not everyday a legend scares you.”
(Latias) “I said I was sorry. We don’t see humans everyday.”
(you) (looking at them both curiously ) “I would guess not and it’s okay.”
(Latios) “I’m going to go out on a limb and guess you have a question: What are we doing here? Am I right?”
You just nod, not really up to talking.
(Latias) “Hey, it’s okay. Like we said, nobody’s perfect. Well we’re here because Mew sent us to deliver that cloak to you because we’re both quick and possibly invisible”
Latios just stares at Latias, giving her a dirty look for interrupting him. She just smiles and shrugs. You can’t help but smile and chuckle at this little. They both grin, knowing you’re a little calmer.
(Latios) “Well we need to get back to Mew. Farewell, Commit Child James and good luck.”
(Latias) “Yeah see you later and good luck. (whispering to you) Sorry for earlier.” (nuzzling you softly)
(you) (embarrassed) “I-it’s okay. Thank you both and farewell for now.”
They both flew away with smiles on their faces, leaving you by the river alone. You touched your face where she rubbed against you, shocked that you actually got to meet Latios and Latias. You pull your cloak to one side and it disappears. You then march back to Rai’s cave and go to his room. You see he is awake and looking around for you.
(you) “Sorry about that Rai. I heard somebody out there and tried to wake you up, but you were deep asleep.”
(Rai) (groggy) “Who was here and what did they want?”
(you) “It was a Ditto and he was looking for me.”
(Rai) (suddenly awake) “What?! And you fought him off?”
(you) “Yep, but only thanks to him being such a snoop and you having so many forks.”
(Rai) “James… if you’re going out for a little while, please leave a note or something. You make me think you’re tired of me and want to leave.”
(you) “Rai… I told you I wouldn’t leave unless there is a good reason. Besides, I like hanging out with you. The question is; do you like being near me?”
(Rai) “Well, yeah, why wouldn’t I?”
(you) “Exactly.”
(Rai) “Sorry.”
(you) “It’s okay. Good night.”
(Rai) “Good night.”
You soon both fell asleep for the night. You woke up the next morning…
11222212112111212122121111211111.title: A Midnight Gift

choices: Walk out of the cave to search
112222121121112121221211112111112.content:
You woke up and the first thing you saw was white. You reach your hands out and find out this white thing is a sheet of paper. It had some writing on the other side. You throw it off and start to look around. You are in Rai’s cave, but Rai wasn’t there. You feel a little scared and alone at the same time. Eventually you look over to the paper which has landed on the bed. You run over and jump, landing safely on the bed. You start reading at the top of the page, and word by word, work your way down.
Paper: Dear James,
I decided to go to school alone today. It’s not because of you, yet it is. It’s not that you did anything wrong, I just wanted to ask around about the Commit Children and thought maybe it would be safer if you weren’t here. After Jared and that Ditto last night, more Pokemon seem to want to get their hands on you. If you aren’t with me, maybe we both can be a little safer. I also wanted to talk to Aura and you said if I ever wanted to, you would be okay with that. I hope you’re not mad because I left you at home. Take care and try not to destroy anything or anyone. Thanks for sticking with me and I’ll see you after school.
-Rai
While you were reading the first part, both guilt and abandonment swept over, but as you read on, things made more sense and you felt better. You looked back over at the table and saw a berry waiting to be eaten. You run back over and, jump then barely climb up to the tabletop. You walk over to the berry and eat it up. You then walk over to the edge and look down. You were about to climb down when you remembered your cloak. You reach where it would be and it appears. You pull it around you and look down again. For some odd reason, you felt the urge to jump off and use the cloak to glide. You always wanted to fly, but jumping and hoping a cloak could save you seemed foolish. You paced back and forth, unsure of what to do. Your mind churned like a stormy ocean. Finally, you figure if your cloak didn’t let you glide, you could turn to steel and drop down. You still were a little nervous about jumping. Finally you gather up the courage and step a few steps away from the edge. You close your eyes, run towards the edge and at the last second, jump off and grab the sides of your cloak. You open your eyes and saw the cloak was letting you glide across the room. It felt exhilarating knowing you could fly without wings. You float until you were a little ways from the ground. Unfortunately you had no clue how to land and put your legs first. You’re sent tumbling and eventually run out of momentum. You stand up and shake off the bad landing. Then you move the cloak over to one side and it fades away. You walk a little ways and start thinking about what to do today. You look at the rest of the cave and the exit, then…
112222121121112121221211112111112.title: Good Morning?

1122221211211121212212111121111121.content: You looked out towards the exit, then made your way towards it. You wanted to stay and practice your techniques, but you also wanted to unite with the other Commit Children. You all had to meet sometime, so why not try and speed it up. Besides, if one of them was in trouble or alone, you could always help them out. You stood at the mouth of the cave and looked at all the places on the island. Walking would take too long, but it seemed like the only way. You sat there and thought about what to do. Then you remembered your ability to change shape. You decided you would fly around. Unfortunately, metal doesn’t fly and most planes would probably look suspicious to the island. You looked up at the sky and recalled one metal Pokemon that could fly: Skarmory. You feel the metal sensation all over and think of how a Skarmory would look. Soon your arms become wings and the rest of the change occurs. Although you could now comb the island a little easier, you were a lot smaller than a normal Skarmory. Hopefully too many people wouldn’t notice and you could fly with ease. You prepped your wings and soon took off. However, you quickly crashed as you had no experience with wings or flying. You sat there practicing for awhile until you finally learned how to use your wings. Takeoff swiftly followed and you were soon soaring through the skies. You would occasionally land to search a new area, then after finding no one, took back to the skies. You look at the skies around you and saw a few more legendaries flying around. Articuno, Zapdos, and Moltres were flying around, staying close to the mountain, but keeping a decent distance away from you. They…
1122221211211121212212111121111121.title: On Steel Wings

choices: You keep looking for other Commit Children
11222212112111212122121111211111212.content:
They looked at you with untrusting eyes and began to attack. You did your best to maneuver away from all of their attacks. Between Moltres’s Flamethrower, Articuno’s Ice Beam, and Zapdos’s Thunder, you barely missed all of them. Eventually, Moltres hit your left wing, Articuno hit your right wing, and Zapdos straight on hit you. Unable to withstand the barrage of attacks, you lost consciousness and plummeted into the forest below. You watched them float in air, then return to circling the mountain just before things went black.

You later wake up to pains shooting across your body. You look at yourself to find you are back to human. Your left arm was a little burnt, your right arm was almost frozen, and your chest was numb. You stayed awake, then moved over to lean against a tree. You stayed there until you could feel your chest again and your right arm seemed warm enough. After making a brief recovery, you stand up and look at the surrounding forest. Then a sharp pain hits your burnt arm and you quickly grasp it. Looking around the forest floor, you see a fallen leaf and go over to it. You turn your arm into a sword and slice the leaf into long strips. You wrap the strips around your burn and use some leaf fibers to tie it up. It didn’t dull the pain, but it made a decent oversized bandage. You sit back down and remain motionless.
(you) (talking to yourself) “How am I supposed to find the other Commit Children? One person trying to find eight others. I can’t fly because I’ll get shot down. I can’t walk because I’ll be out here all night. I guess I could try to tunnel, but I don’t know this island at all. I can’t give up but what other choice do I have. I don’t even know if they have guardians or where they even could be.”
You sat there, feeling like hope was lost. So many places to look, and no clue where to start. You decide that even though you were taken down once, that the second time might be better. You once again change to Skarmory and fly up. You try staying lower to avoid being seen, but they still take notice. All three legends ready an attack, but rather than dodge, you fly straight towards them. Taken by surprise, they rapidly attack. You keep a steady path, flying directly for them. All their attacks seem to be a bit off, but you pay no attention. Finally you were close enough to them and you quickly drop. They gasp and float steadily. You stay on a downward dive, aiming towards Rai’s cave. You pull up just in time to enter his cave. You glide to the table, shift to human form and hide behind a leg. You hear Articuno fly by the entrance, then fly back up. You heard the three birds talking, but couldn’t hear exactly what they were saying. You wait a bit longer, then peek around the leg. Nobody was there and you decided to get some lunch. You needed to get the refrigerator open, but had some size issues. You turn your arm into metal and change it into a crowbar. You barely pry the door open and climb up to where the berries were. You grab one and climb down. You set the berry on the ground and put your full effort into shutting the door. It shuts and you begin to eat. When you had finished, you went to Rai’s room and went under his bed.
(you) (speaking to yourself) “Great, couldn’t even find one person. What a failure I must be! (You turn your fist to metal and begin punching a rock bigger than you.) I’ll bet they found each other no problem. Bet nobody wants to hurt them. But everybody here wants to hurt me. Pick on me till I get back. Then it’s me picking on them, not self-defense. Just like at my school.”
You kept punching the rock until it shattered, hatred flowing through your veins. You turn your hand back to normal and shortly afterwards, pass out.
11222212112111212122121111211111212.title: Same Old Story

112222121121112121221211112111112121.content: You recovered from blacking out and saw the pebbles that were once a whole rock. You stood up and breathed slowly. The anger that had once controlled you had faded and was replaced with a sense of neutrality and relief. You remained motionless, trying to think of what you were doing before, until you remembered that before your rage took over, you were looking for the Commit Children. You walked back to the entrance of the cave and looked out, then up towards the sky. Zapdos, Articuno, and Moltres were still circling the mountain. You were determined to look for the Commit Children at least once more, but getting shot down wasn’t part of the plan. A breeze blew by and you felt your cape move. You pull it over and just stand there. You shift to Skarmory once more and prepped for takeoff. The only thoughts in your head were why you kept passing out after using your powers even though you never felt tired before you passed out and if you would fly in safety. You take off and notice they haven’t seen you. You soared all over, from Coral bay to the school to anywhere you hadn’t looked the first time. You still found nobody and flew home. They still didn’t see you and you landed on the kitchen table, shift back to normal, cloak still over your torso. You pull it over and it fades away. You had looked everywhere and found nobody. You guessed they had found a guardian or vice versa. You sat there before...
112222121121112121221211112111112121.title: Continuing the Search

1122221211211121212212111121111121212.content:
You knew that at this point, searching was just a waste of effort and time. You wandered around the cave until you saw a few lumps of metal. They were melted after you visualized them melting. You started making various shapes and figures from the pool of liquid metal. From pokemon to weapons to geometric figures, you had an arsenal of ideas to experiment with. You made shurikens that were sent flying into the walls. A practice dummy was made and you worked on your fighting skills. Although it was useless, you made metal knuckles and punched with them. Finally, you had to urge to play some music. You made your instruments all metal since you had no choice and soon, a guitar and an ocarina were created. The guitar didn’t play the best without the wooden body and you melted it back into a pile. The ocarina, however, sounded as nice as a porcelain ocarina, but was a bit heavy. Regardless, you played a few songs you could remember. You were about to play the song of the Great Guardian, but went against that idea as it may be a major mistake. The ocarina too was melted back and you reformed all the metal into a statue of a good friend of yours from the human world. You walked up to it, sighed, and thought.
(you) “I wonder how it is back home. I really wish you were here. Maybe you could help me with these powers or keep me company. It’s nice having Rai, but his size is intimidating and I’d like to see another human so I don’t feel so awkward being here.” The puddle melted as you lost focus and collapsed onto your knees. It overwhelmed you knowing that you had no other humans to be near and Rai was probably sick of watching over you. All the negative emotions, feelings, and memories washed over you: Sorrow, betrayal, abandonment, loneliness, failure and others. You walked into Rai’s room and climbed up to the table by the bed. You laid down on the cloths as a single tear rolled down your face.
(you) (thinking) “I’m sorry Rai. All I’ve been is a thorn in your side. I’m sorry everyone I’ve hurt or let down. I just hope you all can forgive me. I guess I’m like steel itself: I try to hold strong, but I break or give way in certain areas, failing at what you needed me to do.”

11222212112111212122121111211111212121.content:
You were in a deep sleep when you saw everyone you knew appear. You wanted to get close to them and talk, but what would the point of that be? This was just a dream and that meant they were just figments of your imagination. But then behind them appeared a wave of other people you knew. Then your best friend spoke up.
(Best friend) “James, we may be fake and not truly with you, but you should know we are with you in heart and mind. All of us up front are the ones have directly affected. The others are ones that have been affected by you, just less directly. We all have been affected by your caring spirit and selfless determination to help others. Remember us always and when you need us, turn to your inner self and we will be there.”
(you) “Thank you, comrade.”
He grinned at you and they all faded into a light. You smiled and felt a surge of confidence hit you. You felt as though you were a rusty, old piece of metal, but their words of encouragement brushed away the rust and gave back what you had lost. You woke up and felt unstoppable. You were just glad no one was here to bring you down or mock you for your words or actions. Finally, a place where you were free from your oppressors and not judged as an outcast. You could no longer contain this pleasure and it came out as the loudest shout you could muster. You took a recovery breath and found your second wind. You looked around the cave and saw it had become somewhat filthy… for a cave that is. You scurry down and worked the entire time on cleaning it up.You finished and nodded with approval. Then…

112232.title: Travis

choices: ... there may be a human around. +
... many think you may be human.
1122321.content:
... It's been a long time since I've thought about my past human life, and to be honest, there's not a whole lot to remember. I wish I could remember more, but time won't wait for you to reach out towards your past. The farther time goes, the more out of reach they become, and now the only characteristic I remember about myself are my eyes: hazel green. When I first came here, or at least what I can remember, is I was just a Zorua. There was a Charmeleon there, too, talking to me about something. It was something like a proposition, and I can remember that part crystal clear... "If you do what I tell you, then your secret is secured, got that?" I could only agree at that point, since my body was banged up pretty bad for some reason. I wish I could know what exactly happened, but nowadays if I try and think about that, I start slowing down on the job. Charmeleon has since then evolved into a Charizard, and I myself am a Zoroark. My job is to collect money from Pokemon who owe Charizard. I don't ask why, I just follow through with the task. I asked about it once... Lets just say I'll never do something that stupid again....

My target today: a Lucario. Him and his family owe Charizard a fair amount of money, and I'm the lap dog picking up the money for him. "If you don't do what I say, I'll tell everyone who you really are, AND I'll return to scorching villages." His threat is what I hold dear in my memory. If I fail to measure up, then thousands may become injured. Or worse... Enough with these horrible thoughts, and back to business. I approach the Lucario residence, and bang on the door while shouting "Lucario, open up! Charizard tells me you owe big time!" Mentioning Charizard's name around here can cause an entire village to hole up, but most residents are submissive to the payments that they are forced to pay. Lucario opens his door and silently hands me a bag of coins. Judging by it's weight, it's not nearly enough to please Charizard. "Where's the rest of it, Lucario?" Lucario growls at the inevitable and comes back with a more acceptable amount. "That's all we have, Zoroark. Now leave us be..." I take the rest of the cash and say quietly "Well, if you know what's best for both of us..."

Within the structure, I see several Riolu hiding behind their mother. Seeing them like that was painful enough, so I look away and start walking. "I won't ever understand you, Zoroark. Deep down, I know you're as bad as Charizard." I wasn't in the mood to argue anymore. "Then I must be the softest side of him." Lucario was angry, but he couldn't do anything about it. He may have read my aura as well, seeing regret and sadness. "I... don't understand why you put up with him. Just quit, and leave everyone alone!" I turn around and look at him with no change in emotion. "I wish I could, Lucario. If I do, I can only guarantee things will get much, much worse. Good night." I took off in the dark night, getting back to Charizard as fast as I could. I lingered long enough. Charizard has set himself up at some ruins beyond Lava Springs, where he stockpiles his collection of coins for unspoken reasons. I hand him today's collecting silently. "Good, good work Zoroark. Who knows, maybe you should be my Hitman later? Heheh!" "Yeah, don't count on that. I'm getting more tired of this every day, and you know it."

"And I DO know, Zoroark. Too bad you and your secret is the only thing keeping you from freedom. However, that's not important right now. You'll actually be given a break from gathering debts. Two weeks at most is your break..." This was shocking news to me. I have never known any period of respite, and here he goes throwing it right into my face. "What!? Are you serious?" Charizard nods, and explains further in detail. "Rumors are going around, and that...
1122321.title: Travis, Charizard's servant...

11223211.content:
This intrigues every bit of me, which can only make sense on my part to ask this next question. "Why not send me out directly to find him? I mean, it's only fitting, right?" Perhaps I was a little too excited, but maybe Charizard partially understands why I would ask that. "That is why I didn't ask you to look for him. You're hard to read sometimes, and I have no idea what may be going through your head at times. How am I supposed to know that you will only ask him a bunch of questions about being human? What if you relate to him? I just can't allow that. Deal with it. I'll tell you one more time: you're on break for two weeks. Got it? Get it? Good. Now get outta my face, before I get too annoyed." Now I'm free for two weeks; I depart immediately, for my sake. I don't want to see him get angry again... But still, what am I going to do for the next two weeks? Sure, I have several interests, but I haven't visited my place in a long time since Charizard would keep me busy almost 24/7. The most convenient path to take is through Fist Falls, which I had already made a previous rendezvous with Lucario.

For some reason, he's the only one who I could ever call a friend. However, Lucario would never even consider being my friend since I usually stop by only to collect coins. Meeting him this early morning was mere coincidence. Lucario was collecting some berries, and now walks to his house with his basket half-way full. He stops and sees me walking down the road that cuts through the village, and he eyes me with hostility. "Why are you back here, Zoroark!? Come for more of our coins or something!? Forget it!" I look at him with exhaustion and say "No, I just happen to be passing by..." I don't think Lucario will let me pass even if I'm here for nothing. "Well, forget coming outta here clean! Get ready for a brawl you'll never forget!" Lucario assumes a fighting stance, and I remain as I was earlier: tired and uninterested. "Lucario, you're the last person on the planet I would want to fight. I don't even want to fight."

"Oh, now you're backing off?"
"That's been the plan."
"Give me a ton of reasons I shouldn't have to fight you, and I may let you through."
"Alright. To begin, you're a Fighting type. I already stand at a disadvantage against you."
"You got that right! You'll need a lot more excuses than that!"
"Well, I would think in all honesty that you wouldn't want any trouble either in my shoes."
"Go on..."
"I don't have to take any more money for the next two weeks. I've been given a very, very generous respite from a job I hate with a burning passion."
"Hah! Why would YOU hate your job? You take coins to share with Charizard!"
"I'm given nothing. I do my job to keep his threats from becoming reality. I don't buy food, I usually get it myself in the river, unlike you having the luxury of buying it already cooked."
"I can't even buy anything with no money! How do I know if you're just making all of this up?"
"Do you really want me to say why?"
"Yes. I'll let you leave if you tell me."
"Because if I were to consider anyone as my friend, I'd want you as a friend."
"... Come again?"

Lucario was taken aback by my answer. He may have thought of me as a complete monster before, but to hear that from someone like myself... "... How do I know you're not lying to me...?" I assume I have made a very weak bond with him, one hinting at friendship or maybe even friendly enemies. "I can't tell you that you should believe me, because I actually believe that you may believe me." "Uh...
11223211.title: ... there may be a human around. +

112232111.content:
"... I don't know if I'll regret this, but I... I suppose I believe you, I guess." Lucario moves out of the way, and allows me passage towards my home. "Thank you, Lucario... Here, take this. I was wanting to return it to you anyway." I drop a sack of coins into his paw, and he examines it only to find familiarity with it. "Isn't this..." I walk down the pathway, and leave Lucario in a state of wonder...

**Reader: Be Travis again!**


I made it to my forlorn structure of a home, built around a large tree that could support a structure as big as a small house. I had made it myself when I had a lot of more free time on my hands, several years ago when I only recently assumed a new identity of a Zoroark. It took quite a long time to finish, because I wanted to take time making it. It's very well refined, with the dimensions neat and aligned with each other, resulting in a house that doesn't creak at every step you take. I notice almost no difference in shape, but it currently is covered with vines and other plants. The door on the bottom was still locked into place, so that was a good sign. "Home sweet home..." I use a hand made key that I retrieve from a nearby hollow stone
I carved it out myself, so that I could hide something important inside it. Like a key.
, which slides into a hole and pushes a few gizmos inside to allow entry... Yup, everything was pretty much the same. I get comfortable on a bed that I had also made myself... I generally make everything myself, being without money can put limits on one's self if they're not careful.

I remember Charizard talking about a human... I wonder what a human looks like? Not many know, since they only appear in some old books. Are they tall? Short? Smart? I can only imagine right now... I open some nearby curtains to reveal a window, made from highly compressed and heated sand that only residents from Lava Springs could make. We do have technology around here, but I'm not a big fan of it all. There's just something about old customs that can only bring a smile to my face, I don't really know why... "Oh, wow... Shooting stars..." I see several little lights streaking across the sky, disappearing as they burn in the atmosphere of our planet. One appears to be moving slowly, orange in color and getting bigger... "Wait... oh, cra---"
