... Some time later, after the forest is saved and Travis gets taken to a medical structure...


**Reader: Be Travis again!**


... A cool breeze strokes my body, relieving me after being in such a hot situation. "Well, his legs received quite a blow... We guessed it happened when he was inside, and some of the house collapsed on him. He's okay now, but he shouldn't run around any time soon or he may turn a minor fracture into some serious damage." I rub my head, feeling it pound away at my skull to let me know "Hey! I'm a pretty nasty headache!" The nurse continues the list to Ryo: "His burns will heal in a few days, but the burn marks around his claws may be permanent. He... does have money to pay for this, doesn't he?" I sit up on the mattress, taking interest in the conversation the two Pokemon are having... I guess I have quite the fee on my head. "He's broke, actually... He gave the last of it to me. I'm more than willing to pay for it..." I look over at Ryo, and tell him "Lucario, if you pay for it, I'll have to return the favor, you know?"

"Yeah, I knew by your aura that you would say something like that..." Then, I remembered... Oh, no... The small creature in the rock...!
11223211111.title: Fire Fighting

112232111111.content:
"... I need to go back to my house..." Ryo looks at me while crossing his arms, saying "There's nothing left, really. You can find a new tree and start over again, and maybe I can even help you out." I wipe my face with my claws, trying to show externally how much I don't want to discuss relocating. I'll go ahead and add in a sentence or two with that. "I know there's nothing left, and I really don't want to talk about it... I'll be back, I just need to look." I stand up and head for the exit, but Ryo blocks my path. Is everyone really trying to get me on edge here? "Oh, no. I can see it written all over you. You're doing something else, aren't you?" I know at that point I should have been more secretive about it earlier, because now, Ryo's interested. "Ugh, since you won't let me go... I'm looking for something I found when my house was on fire. I don't know what it is, but it's a little weird." "Well, can I come since you told me just now?" I look down at the floor, mumbling "Yeah, you can go... Since we're friends, alright?" I look back up at him, and he has a grin on his face that I never imagined I'd see on a Lucario. "Well, you're a work in progress, y'know, with opening up a bit. Alright, lead the way Zoroark."

I move in front of him and start walking down a familiar path, telling Ryo "My name's Travis, just so you know." "I thought you would have a more intimidating name than that, but that's fine, Travis." Ignoring his remark on my name, I continue down the path and into the halfway charred forest. "You can already see my house from here... Or should I say the remaining bits of it?" Lucario now walks beside me, shrugging. "Your pick. I'd just call it your old house." I now found myself standing in close proximity to my, I suppose, 'old house' as Ryo calls it... "Where did I set it...?" I look around the forest area that hadn't been burnt; Ryo looks around and asks "What exactly are we looking for here?" I explain to him that it's a round, hollow rock with something sitting inside of it. He understood, and together we went around to try and find the small creature... Then, I see the rock. "Ah, I found it Ryo. It's over here..."

I walk up to it...

I peer inside the carved out hole...

Ryo looks inside it as well, and saw...
112232111111.title: The Search Next to Ashes

1122321111111.content:
**Reader: You are now the creature**


... You seem to be having a hard time being this weird creature. For one, you have no idea what it is, and identifying it as a human earlier was merely coincidental and only helps you understand what is in the rock. Maybe you can try to be this creature, although once again, you have no idea what a human is, looks like, or (in some cases) question the mere existence of thumbs. What are thumbs, you say? Wait, you didn't ask that. Of course you know what thumbs are, that would only be silly as to not know what thumbs are. Oh, sorry, you seem to be asking what does he look like. So without further ado, what does he look like? Oh, wait, we know his gender now by the intelligent being who has created this alternate timeline (text)! This is getting ridiculous now... Okay, you are OFFICIALLY the creature now, I mean human.

... Where are you? ... I don't know, I think some sorta cold space. It's cramped, and I don't really like it. I'm... finding this frightening now. I don't want to wake up, this is all too unsettling! He squirms a little bit to confirm his location, and for one thing, it's confirmed: a really cramped, hard and round space. Fresh air is freely flowing in, so less panicking is sure to happen. Okay, okay, stay calm man... Oh man! Loud voices...! This... is... really... exciting! Who are they? They sound like giants; oh! They may be talking to me, or about me. They're wondering if I'm alright... He opens his eyes... "Whoa!"

**Reader: Travis: Converse**


I see a small creature inside, and it exclaims in surprise at us. "Whoa!" I'm a bit in surprise as well, seeing something so small, yet so interesting and strange. "Uh... Hello?" It's expression lightens as he hears my greeting, replying back "Hello there." I'm taken aback by it's, uh, guts to speak to someone of my size... That is, to his perspective anyway. His appearance, however, is all too familiar to me, as if I have seen a creature like him before. "What are you exactly? Or I guess, who, are you?" Ryo asks the creature politely, and then looks at me. "... And where did you find it!?" The creature answers first... "Well, I'm...
1122321111111.title: Hello? Hello. :0

1122322.content:
Name: Andrew Bost
Hair: Blonde, shaven
Eyes: Blue
Description: A tall young man who loves being with friends, enjoys water, sports, exersizing, and weekends. Hates/Fears heights, rude/pompus people, being made fun of behind the back. Wants to do something amazing with his life and not just be an average person.
1122322.title: Andrew

11223221.content:
It was just an average day for you. You were walking home from school irritated by the fact you have a Spanish quiz tomorrow because you hate Spanish. "Stupid spanish!" you think, " If I didnn't have that I would have the rest of today completely off." You sigh i frustration as you round the corner which leads down to your block.

"As soon as I get home, I'm getting straight to studying because it takes FOREVER to learn Spanish." you think. You finally reach your home and get to your door. "Key time." you think. As you rumage through your backpack looking for the keys, everything spills out! "URGH! Darn it!" you exclaim. "Stupid crap..." you mumble as you gather it toghether and grasp the keys. As you fumble the key in the lock you get more frusterated and shove the door open. You quickly walk into your house, only to suddenly start free-falling!

You scream the entire way down until you finally land in a large body of water. For a while, the wind is knocked out of you and you barely struggle to the surface. As you gasp for breath you begin to panic. "Oh my gosh! What was that?! What's going on?!" You soon begin to paddle towards what you think you can see as land. After hours of swimming you finnaly reach shallower waters. "I can't *huff* go *huff* any *huff* further." you think. Suddenly, a large wave pushes you onto land and you can't help but smile. The weariness of your long swimm then catches up to you, and you happily give in, not carring what could be nearby. You then faint and are left there to survive. But you weren't awake to see something find you and carefully take you deeper into the island.
11223221.title: The New Begining.

112232211.content:
Hours later, you begin to wake up, but it is very painful. "urrrgghh" you grunt as you merely open your eyes and start to move. "What, what happened? Where am I?" you say out loud. As you try to get up your body flares with pain. "Ow!" you say meekly as you move back down. The pain doesn't stop for a while and you're left there to lay in pain.

As soon as you get the energy to look around you see that your not be the water any more, but what appears to be a comfortable, if somewhat empty, room. You are taken aback by this at first, but you soon settle down. You look out the window in the room and see the ocean outside. That's when you realize something. The room was huge! You couldn't believe your eyes as you looked out across the plain of a bed you were laying on! Everything was ginormous, and made you feel like an insignificant bug. "That's what I am here," you think "a bug." "Who's room is this? And more importantly, why is everything so big, and why am I in here, and what does this person want with me?!" you mumble to yourself in a panicked manner.

"They might want to hurt me! I've got to get out of here!!" you frantically think. As you try to sit up and pull the sheets up, the worst and biggest wave of pain washes over you and you fall back down screaming in pain in your mouth. "It's hopeless." you admit to yourself. "I just hope that who ever they are won't hurt me." you silently whimper. That's when you notice something else, your body was completely bandaged! Basically every part of you body had rags tired over them and were fit tightly just like a bandage, you feel your head to find another cloth wrapped around it. These facts calm your fears a little. "If someone went to this much trouble for me, I doubt that they would want to hurt me." you think. You decide to do something you think is crazy, you begin to call out for anyone that could hear you. "HELLO? IS ANYBODY IN HERE? HELLO?" you shout probably too loudly. But that didn't matter because at almost the exact same moment the large door of the bedroom opened to reveal a large figure in the doorway."Oh good, you're finally awake, I was getting worried." a...
112232211.title: Waking Up.

choices: "Could you get me some water, please?"
1122322111.content:
"You were getting worried?" you ask not really sure how to respond. "Why?" "Well, why wouldn't I?" the figure questions. "After all I didn't have to take you back home when I found you by my local pond." "Wait a second, that was only a pond!?!" you shout in disbelife. "But when I tried to swim to shore it was absolutely huge!" you exclaim. You hear a small giggle escape from the figure at the door. "Well don't be to embarassed. That is pretty big for a pond, and it's not like your that big or anyting."

You can't elp but to take some offence at her comment. "Well excuse me for not being big enough to just wade through it!" you exclaim quite irretably. "Alright calm down," says the figure cautiously, "I didn't mean any offence. And try not to get too angry or irritated, you'll only hurt yourself." she says in a concerned tone. "Okay." you give in. "I'm sorry for getting angry so quickly, I shouldn't be so rude to a lady especially one that saved my life." Yet another figure escapes from the large figure. "No worries. I'm just glad to see that your feeling better, and I wouldn't say that you owe me your life or anything. But it is always nice to have a sweet gentlemen around to give his heroen complements." She says in a flirty tone. You can't help but laugh at this and neither could she.

"By the way, who are you?" you ask when you both stop laughing. "I should at least thank you properly and I can't do that without knowing your name." "Oh, of course I haven't introduced myself yet. How rude of me!" she comments. "My name's Dewa (Do-a)." "Dewa? What kind of name is that?" you think to yourself. "Does my name confuse you? I'm not sure but I think it does judging by your face." says the figure. "Well I admit it kinda does." you admit sheepishly. "But that's probably because I can't even see you." "You can't? Then I'll move somewhere where you can see me." She says. The figure finally steps out of the shadows and, again, you couldn't believe your eyes.

Standing before you at the edge of the gigantic be was an even more gigantic Dewott! If you hadn't gotten to know her a little before she showed herself you probably would have yelled in surprise, but you couldn't help to still jump in surprise. "Surprised?" Dewa askes. "That can't begin to describe how I'm feeling!" you say. "Don't worry," Dewa says with an amazingly heartwarming and friendly smile, "I'm not gonna hurt ya. Well, on purpose you're just so cute I could cuddle you for hours! But we have more important things to deal with." Dewa then approaches you on the side of the bed.

"What are you doing?" you ask quiet timidly. She gives another sweet smile in an effort to comfort you. "Just relax, I'm just checking to see how your injuries are doing." As she gently undoes the rag on your head you can't help but slink back in anervous manner. And who could blame you, it's not every day that a giant Pokemon is carefully removiing rags from your miniscule body. Once she had undone all of the rags and thouroughly checked your injuries, she gave a relieved sigh and addressed you, "It looks like you've made a full recovey! But I still think you should rest for a while longer so you can gain your strength back." Dewa then stares at you with a loving look in her eyes. "Do you wan't anything before you rest?" She asks.
1122322111.title: Sweet feminime voice says. +

choices: being poked by Dewa, because dinner is ready. +
laying peacfully in bed, completely undisturbed.
11223221111.content:
"Of course! That's no trouble at all." says Dewa happily. "I'll be back in a flash. Make sure to get nice and comfortable!" "Thank you!" you yell as she leaves the room. You still couldn't believe that this was happening. "This is crazy!" you think laughing to yourself. "If I didn't have such a crazy imagination and if didn't just feel pain a few minutes ago, then I would never believe this is real. But I'm glad that it is." you think. "Dewa seems like a really nice girl/Pokemon and she seems to like having me around. I just hope that we can figure out what we should do about my situation and I really want to become better friends with her." Once you finish that thought, Dewa comes back into the room with a small bottle cap.

"I just realized that I don't have any cups you size." she says. "So I just filled a water bottle cap full of water. Do you mind?" she asks. "Not at all," you reply, "and thanks again." when she gives you the cap you quickly begin to drink the water. But you drink to fast and the water ends up spilling all over you! Dewa giggles as you sputter on the water and at the humiliated expression on your face. "I think that's enough." she says while giggling, "Now get some rest, I'll wake you when it's time for dinner. Yell for me if you need anything." She then takes the cap away from you, and fixes your pillow and bed sheets so they were more comfortable. She kisses you once on the head and whispers, "Sweet dreams."

After she closes the door behind her, you quickly drift off into a deep sleep. When you wake up, you find yourself in a completely blank world with absolutely nothing in it. "That's weird," you think, "it must be a dream." "You..." says a ghostly voice, "you are one of the chosen." You felt an icy cold chill all over your body, and you begin to shiver. Suddenly, you feel an ice cold hand clamp onto your shoulder. You turn around in panic, only to nearly faint as you look straight at a ghostly figure of an older version of you reaching towards your face. "Do not be afraid." it says, "I am the embodiment of your inner power and courage. I have come here to tell you that you are in this world to help save it." "What?" you question, not understanding what's going on. "It will all become clear in due time." says the spirit, "but for now, I shall let you know that you are exactly where you are supposed to be. You will learn more later." Immediately you want to question the spirit but it turns into nothing but a wraith and begins to let out a horrible screech. As you fall down covering your ears in pain, you begin to wake up and you find yourself...
11223221111.title: A good rest and interesting dream.

112232211111.content:
As the sleep slowly fades form your eyes, you feel a playful poking sensation at your side. Like always when you get up, you just stare blankly in the direction you’re facing for a few seconds, which happens to be right at Dewa. She had that same amazing smile from before spread across her face. "Come on." she says "It's time to wake up you little cutie you!" You moan in tiredness and turn over facing away from Dewa. "Five more minutes." you mumble. Dewa giggles at your little remark. "Come on you! You've slept for four hours already it's already dark!" You sleepily look out the window to see the moon high in the sky. "Good. Now you can go to bed too and will both be rested for tomorrow." Dewa laughs at you; you must really not want to get up! "What about dinner?" she asks. You groan again, "We can have a big breakfast!"

Dewa finally had enough of playing around with you. She undid the covers, and gently picked you up. "Fine! I'll get up." you mumble as you sit up. "Good!" she says, "Because dinner's ready." As she walks out of the bedroom she addresses you again, "I wasn't sure what you would want to eat, so I just got you what I'm having." You yawn, "I'm sure it'll be fine. Thanks by the way." "Your welcome!" she responds with a smile, and you smile back. When you reach the kitchen, you notice it's about the same as any normal kitchen in a wood cabin. There's a stove, a fridge, a couple of cabinets, and a small table to eat on. "Nice place you got here." you mumble, but Dewa wasn't listening because at the moment she was bringing over dinner. She sets down a large basket full of berries down on the table in front of you, and gives you another bottle cap of water. "Try not to spill on yourself this time!" she says in a mock tone. As she picks out certain berries ad sets them in front of her, you take small sips of your water and examine each of the individual berries. "They look delicious!" you think.

Dewa notices the hungry look on your face and smiles. "I can tell you like the looks of theses berries," she says, "but you should let me choose for you, a lot of them would be way too strong for your taste buds right now." She begins to look through her basket for a certain berry she thinks that you could handle. "Aha! Here it is." she says as she pulls out a round, blue colored berry and sets it in front of you. The berry was quite large; it was about the same height as you. You could probably hide behind it in order to avoid being seen by anything. "Awww." Dewa cues, "I never noticed you were the same size as a berry, how cute!" You blush at the fact that she thinks your cute, it felt weird; it felt like you were being treated kind of like a pet. "That's an oran berry." she tells you, "It's a very common berry, but everyone loves it because it has such a natural and well balanced taste. I think you'll love just as much as everyone else does!" she ends with a smile. "The berry does look good." you think, "Oh what the heck!" You quickly take a bite out of the huge berry and your mouth is flooded with the most amazing sensation of flavor you have ever experienced! You begin viciously attacking the berry with your mouth eating as much as you can. "Slow down little guy!" Dewa says, "I don't want you getting a stomachache!"

You then remember your manners and quickly stop. "Sorry." you say pretty embarrassed. "No worries!" Dewa replies as she begins to eat as well. Your meal goes on silent for a few minutes when Dewa suddenly speaks. "Oh my gosh! I can't believe I've been so rude!" She says out loud. "How?" you ask with a slight chuckle. "I haven't even asked you your name yet! And you were such a gentlemen earlier asking me for my name. But I guess late is better than never." she says, bringing her attention to you. "So tell me about yourself." she says. You quickly swallow your mouth full of food and get a quick drink before speaking. "Well," you start, "there isn't much to tell. My name is Andrew, I'm about fourteen years old, I'll be fifteen on November 14, I come from a family of seven," you pause for a quick breath, "I'm the youngest of five children, I have three older sisters and one older brother, I don't have a job yet, and I'm a freshmen at high school." The entire time you continue to talk Dewa listens to you with her full attention, occasionally taking a bite of food or drinking some water. "And that's about it." you conclude. "Well!" Dewa says, "Andrew I never would have guessed you had such a busy life. But it's nice to finally fully meet you." she says with a smile. "The pleasure's all mine." you say, "Okay now it's your turn.”Alright," she says, "where should I start?" For the next few minutes or so, she tells you about her life, family, and friends. It turns out that she' in high school to, and you were kind of shocked to learn that they had school here, wherever this place is. You both finish your meals soon after she finishes telling you about herself, and she puts the basket away in a cabinet. "By the way," you speak up, "I forgot to ask. Where are we?" Dew smiles at you again which warms you to the core. "Where in Coral Bay on Emerald Island. This island is divided into multiple individual towns, each home to many different types of Pokemon. In Coral Bay, there is generally water type Pokemon. The school I told you about earlier is for every type of Pokemon. So it's not like water types have their own school or anything.

You nod as you process the information. "This sounds like a pretty cool place." you think. "Well I think it's time for bed." Dewa says. She holds her hand out for you and you quickly jump on it. It felt so warm on her hand like paw and you almost fall asleep right there. But you are soon taken outside, and are brought to a large body of water. "Well," Dewa says looking at you, "this is the pond where I found you!" Your are utterly shocked. "Wait!" you say, "This is the pond where you found me!? It is a lot bigger than other ponds. You were right." She giggles at your shocked face. "I come hear to brush my teeth, and that's how I found you this morning." she tells you. She gently places you on the ground and tells you to wait for her. She then quickly goes to too a large bush and grabs two leaves. "Here you go." she says as she hands you a small leaf. "This is a mint leaf, you can use it to brush your teeth." she tells you. She spends the next few minutes with you, telling you how to use the special leaf to brush your teeth and watch you finish brushing after you learn. Once you're both done, she gently picks you up without warning, but you didn't mind, and took you back to her bedroom where you first woke up hours ago. When you get back to her room, she addresses you, "Ohhhh. I forgot to make you a bed." she grumbles. She stares down at you in her hand with a nervous smile. "you don't mind sleeping in my bed do you?" she asks awkwardly. You blush at the idea, but you manage to respond "Sure I don't mind." She gives another awkward smile and only says, "Great." She grasps you in one hand as she gets into her bed. She gently sets you down on her pillow and pulls her soft bed sheets over you. "Good night Andrew." Dewa whispers, "And remember, if you need anything just ask me." she says. She gives another kiss on the head before she goes to sleep. You smile to yourself and think, "This is great!" As sleep begins to take over your mind again, you whisper one more thing to Dewa before you fall asleep, "Sweet Dreams Dewa." After saying that, you fall asleep with a happy smile on your face.
112232211111.title: Dinner and getting to know each other.

1122322111111.content:
You sleep uninterrupted this time. As you stretch out your limbs, after waking up from your comfortable sleep, you look around expecting to find yourself in Dewa's bed lying next to her gigantic body. However, you can't even see or guess what area is surrounding you! It was completely black, and wherever you went, you either ran into or tripped over something. "Where the heck am I?" is all you can think about as you stumble around aimlessly.

Suddenly, light fills your entire "prision" and, after your eyes fully adjust, you can see Dewa smiling down at you. "It's about time you woke up!" she says as she carefully grabs you. "You slept straight through breakfast and the entire ride here." You stare at her with a blank expression on your face. "Here?" you finally speak,” Here, where?" Dewa giggles as she sets you down on a cold metal surface. "At school, duh. Where did you think we were?" You dumbly reply, "I don't know, your house? You didn't tell me you had school today." She smirks a little, "I didn't tell you that? Huh, must have slipped my mind." You can't help but smile, you must have looked like an idiot when you asked that question, and you laugh at a mental image of yourself asking that question.

“Anyway,” Dewa speaks up, snapping you back to your senses, “I was just checking if you were awake, I didn’t think it would be very comfortable in my book bag.” She trails off as she grabs a few books and other objects from her locker, which you are apparently standing in. “So what am I supposed to do for the next few hours?” you ask. Dewa seems to be in deep thought for a minute as she stares intently at a large, to her because to you it was absolutely gigantic, book before she looks at you again. “Hm? Oh, uhhh I’m not exactly sure. I was just thinking that you could rest in my bag or something.” You didn’t really like the sound of that. “That sounds pretty boring.” you complain. You mentally scold yourself for being so rude. Dewa didn’t seem to mind though, “Sorry, but I can’t let anyone see you. I don’t want to freak you out or anything, but if someone saw, they might take you away and lock you up for research or dissect you!”’

Your face becomes void of all color when she mentions the word “dissect”. Dewa quickly tries to comfort you as she grabs and snuggles you against her cheek whispering, “Don’t worry, I’ll never let that happen.” As soon as you calm down, Dewa gently sets you down onto her locker again. “Are you okay?” she asks sounding extremely concerned. “Yeah.” you reply, “I think it’s time you get to class.” She still has a concerned look on her face when she says, “Alright.” After she gently sets you back down into her bag, she begins to walk towards her next class.
1122322111111.title: School?! (That's what got me in this mess!)

choices: One of Dewa's friends come for a surprise visit! +
11223221111111.content:
The rest of your day is pretty boring. All throughout the day, you just sat there in Dewa's bag. You were always getting hit by random objects or tripping over things. Your only source of entertainment was trying to listen to Dewa's Classes, and that wasn't easy. Her bag was barely open, she would have it closed but you had to breathe, and not much sound got into it. You try to listen in at first, but it was extremely boring. The first class had was History about the island or something.

The next class was even less interesting, apparently Dewa was interested in Art. The entire class, all you hear is scribbling and the occasional question or comment from a student or teacher. You tried to fall asleep during the class, but whenever you were about to drift into the land of dreams, something woke you up. Dewa didn't check on you must and you never really got to talk to her.

At last it was lunch time, and you were hoping you could finally get out of the bag. But unfortunately, Dewa had to meet with some teacher about some project or assignment she missed. When you heard you were skipping lunch, you just flopped onto the ground and started to groan. Thankfully, you finally managed to fall asleep while she was talking with her teacher and miss the rest of the day. You even slept through the bus ride home.

When she got home and unpacked her things, she decided to wake you up. With you still in her now empty book bag, she flips it over, and you tumble out of it headfirst onto the table. "What the heck?" you mumble as you recover from the fall and your sleep. You never really liked saying stuff like "What the hell?" and other crap like that. You look around while rubbing your head, trying to figure out where you are. "Just so you know," Dewa says behind you, "you're at my house again." You're then presented with a bottle cap of water and another Oran berry. "So how did you like your first day at my school?" she asks biting into a berry. "Honestly, it sucked!" you reply. "I thought you'd say that!" she responds laughing. "At least you didn't have to sit through those classes." she complains. "You have a point there." you reply with a chuckle. Suddenly, the two of you are interrupted when...
11223221111111.title: Another Boring Day at School!

112232211111111.content:
"Guess who's here?" rang out an unknown but musical voice. The moment you heard that voice, you almost fell in love with it. The voice was so beautifully used and heard that it made you swoon. In this feminine voice was not only music, but love and understanding. Who ever she was, you would not have hesitated to meet her in any way. Anyone with such a lovely voice couldn't be evil to you. Dewa on the other hand had the opposite idea. After all, you can never be too careful.

As quick as a flash, Dewa scoops you up and drops you into a nearby glass of water. That wasn't exactly the best spot to hide in. As you recover from the sudden surprise and try to keep above the surface of the water, you try to listen in on Dewa's conversation. "Glacia!" Dewa says, trying to sound happy. "Um, what are you doing here?" "I came to visit you silly!" You hear Dewa let out an awkward laugh. "Well you could've visited me at school instead then." She replies. "Well then it wouldn't be surprising!" counters Glacia. "Alright look." says Dewa, losing all of the fake enthusiasm in her voice. "You never visit me here unless you have a favor to ask of me."

"Alright you win, I admit it." Glacia concedes. "Ha!" yells Dewa, "I knew it! Now what do you want?" Glacia cleared her throat before speaking. "Well, my parents are going away on their anniversary for a while, so I need a place to stay. And-" "No way." Dewa interrupts. "You can't stay here. Why don't you try your cousin's Shiki's place?" "I can't." replies Glacia, "She won't have enough room. She's already staying with Miku, Jet, and Storm. Come on please!" she begs. At first Dewa manages to keep saying no, but after constant begging from Glacia, she finally gives in. "Oh fine! You can stay." she says irritably.

"Yes!" cheers Glacia, "Thanks so much." "Whatever." Dewa replies. The situation with Glacia and the annoyance of Glacia's begging had gotten into Dewa's head and made her forget about you! She reached down to take a drink of water from the glass that you were in! As she brought the glass closer to her mouth, you try to get her attention by shouting her name, but to no avail. Soon, you were sent careening into her mouth and at the mercy of her natural instincts.

Your puny presence went unnoticed in Dewa's mouth, and you were carelessly shoved into Dewa's throat. The strong muscles try to force you down her throat, and into your doom, but you manage to hold on. Unfortunately, this caused Dewa to start choking and naturally she starts swallowing harder. You desperately try to keep your grip and you would've lost it if Glacia hadn't performed the Heimlich Maneuver Dewa, causing you to fly out of her mouth and onto the table.

The shock from the situation you just underwent was so serious, that you weren't able to recover for quite some time. In fact, you didn't even notice that Glacia noticed you lying on the table. What kind of Pokemon is Glacia?
112232211111111.title: That was close!

1122322111111111.content:
"Well, well, well." Glacia purred. "What have we here?" She brought her head down onto the table so she could get a better look at you. You noticed her gazing at you and you tense up, not sure what to do. Other than Dewa, this was the first gigantic pokemon you've seen and you were scared. Her face was emotionless as her large teal eyes scanned your body. You had know idea what to do; so you just stand there trembling and look into those beautiful, but intimidating eyes.

When Dewa had finally regained her composure, she realized that Glacia had seen you and was inspecting you. Dewa was afraid this would happen. She could tell that when you heard Glacia's voice you really wanted to meet her. But she knew you would be scared of her. She was over five times your size, probably even more than that. If she was you, she would be afraid of Glacia too. "Glacia I can explain." She began.

"Oh really?" Glacia asks, turning her attention to Dewa. "How do you explain that you have a human, a rare mythological creature? How do you explain that you were hiding a human from me? How do you explain why you wanted to hide him from me? How do you explain why you almost swallowed him? And how do you explain..." She pauses getting right in front of Dewa's face. "How do you explain... how ADORABLE he is!?" she squeals. She basically runs back to the table, brings you towards her face, and nearly cuddles you to death. The entire time, she's cooing and mumbling about how cute you are. Whatever fear you had of her had completely disappeared and it was replaced with laughter. Her cuddling was an amazing experience! It was like having the world's biggest and softest pillow being rubbed against you but only a million times better.

Dewa stared at you and Glacia in shock. Just a few seconds ago, you were trembling just at the sight of her. But now you were laughing and enjoying yourself as Glacia eagerly snuggled against you. Despite the weirdness of the situation, Dewa sighed a breath of relief. "At least Andrew won't be afraid of her while she stays here. I just hope they don't do that all the time." She thinks as she sits back down and drinks her water again.
1122322111111111.title: The Cat's out of the bag!

11223221111111111.content:
After several more moments of watching you and Glacia snuggle, Dewa finally had enough. "Alright you two, snuggle time is over." She said. "Glacia, give him some room to breath!" Glacia finally backs away from you with a happy smile on her face. "Sorry about that you two; but I just couldn't help myself!" She said cheekily. You were still in a trance from your earlier experience and stood there completely oblivious to the world around you. "Um, Earth to Andrew." Dewa said. "It's time to get back to reality." You shake yourself out of your trance and begin to blush in embarrassment. "Sorry about that." You chuckle nervously.

"So his name is Andrew?" Glacia mused. "It definitely suits him. I can't believe I'm talking to an actual human! This is so exciting!" She squealed. "What do you mean by that?" You ask. "What's so weird about seeing a human? Dewa didn't seem shocked at all when we first met." Glacia smiled gently before speaking, "Well Andrew, let me explain. You see, once very long ago our certain amount of great ancestors discovered this island and made it their home. For a long time, we made homes and developed societies without interference of any kind. But, we eventually got to the center of the island and that's when we discovered something incredible. We discovered a race of tiny creatures that we equal to our level of intelligence. For a long time our ancestors thought that we were the only species capable of talking and thinking logically. Image our ancestor's surprise when they discovered you humans." Glacia says enthusiastically.

"Our ancestors tried to become friends with the little humans, but to no avail. The humans were terrified of our ancestors because of their size. They thought they were monsters and wanted to destroy them. Apparently, the humans were never supposed to have existed on this island. Some kind of strange magical force had brought a group of humans to the island because they were supposed to fulfill a great destiny. But that generation wasn't the right group and therefore suffered greatly while they were here. Slowly, as our ancestors inhabited the island around them, they began to die because they lacked the resources to survive. Our ancestors tried desperately to help them, but the humans were too scared of them and always drove them away. Eventually, all of the humans left the area our ancestors found them and they were assumed to be dead. Eventually, most of us forgot about you humans and you became only a myth. The fact that you're here is truly a miracle." Glacia finished.

"You are quite knowledgeable young Glacia." A mysterious but feminine voice said, seemingly from nowhere. Suddenly, a Pokemon reveals itself to the three of you. It happens to be none other than...
11223221111111111.title: Humans are Myths!?

112232211111111111.content:
You couldn't believe your eyes! Floating in front of you was the legendary Pokemon Mew! You're not sure if it's because of fear or wonder, but you feel the urge to bow down in front of her and you do. There is a moment of silence but it is eventually interrupted by... giggling? Looking up, you notice that neither Glacia nor Dewa were bowing in front of Mew and that all three of them were laughing at you. "Wh-what's so funny?" You stammer in embarrassment. "You are!" Dewa says laughing. "Why are you bowing?" Glacia says amused. "I-I thought it was expected with Mew. I thought she was important!" You say incredibly embarrassed.

"Mew doesn't request we bow to her." Dewa said, her laughter dying down. "Most of the other legendaries don't either." You cheeks literally become red with embarrassment and you chuckle awkwardly and nervously. "There's no need to be embarrassed." Mew said comfortingly. "You would never have known that; so don't be embarrassed." This makes you feel a little better and your blushing reduces to a much less drastic shade. "Forgive me if I'm being to frank Mew." Dewa began. "But why are you here?"

"I came here to tell you a little story about your human friend. It's very important." Mew said. "Will it tell me why I'm here?" You ask timidly. Mew smiled gently, "It will explain many things, and answer many of your questions. Are you all ready to hear it?" The three of you nod and Mew begins to tell her story. "It all happened long ago. A couple years after the humans on the island were presumed dead. Your ancestors had all settled down on the island and lived in relative peace. They enjoyed simple and happy lives for quite a long time. The only thing that ever bothered them was the fact that the humans had died and that your ancestors were unable to anything to help them. That's when everything changed. Your ancestors were attacked by an evil race known as "The Night Crawlers". Your ancestors were hopelessly outmatched until 'they' appeared. A group of nine heroic Pokemon resisted the Night Crawlers. The Nine easily beat back the vicious creatures and basically defeated them. But, they had not yet faced their greatest challenge. A gigantic Night Crawler known as "The Destroyer" attacked the heroes, seeking vengeance for its fallen brothers and sisters. The creature was too strong for the nine heroes and they would've been defeated if they had not combined their powers and destroyed it. All though The Destroyers physical form was destroyed, a spiritual essence remained of the creature. The nine heroes took that essence to another island and sealed it away behind an indestructible barrier in the back of the island's largest cave. With the world at peace again the 9 Hero’s left the island never to be heard from again. But before they left they sent an essence from each one of the 9 Hero’s to another dimension to find a successor. The successors of these hero’s are known as Commit Children and have the amazing powers of the heroes. The peace the heroes brought to this world has lasted for a long time, but now it is beginning to fade." Mew finally finishes.

"Wait." You say. "What does this have to do with me? I mean I can't POSSIBLY be one of the Commit Children, right?" You ask somewhat scared. "Yes you are a Commit Child! And you will not be afraid of being one, because you can do it." Mew says sternly starring at you. You, Glacia, and Dewa were all incredibly shocked and couldn't believe it. "You can't be serious Mew." Glacia and Dewa say in union. "Oh, but I'm completely serious." Mew says. "Andrew is a Commit Child and you two must protect him until he masters his powers and finds the other eight Commit Children." Mew commands. "Could you at least tell me where the other Commit Children are? You must have talked to at least some of them already?" You ask desperately.

Mew giggles at you, "I can't do that. That would make your job to simple; I can't do your job for you! It's your destiny, so you must find them yourself." You all finally accept your responsibilities and Mew is about to leave. But before she left she had a request for you. "Could I give you a quick cuddle?" She asks shyly. "O-Of course." You say awkwardly. Mew floats over to you, gently levitates you into her hands, and cuddles you against her cheek "You're the only one who's let me do that." You hear Mew in your mind. "So far you're my favorite." Mew then sets you down and disappears in a puff of pink smoke. The three of you stand there in silence for quite some time. "This just got a lot more interesting." You think.
112232211111111111.title: Much more interesting than history class!

choices: You wake up next morning, undisturbed.
1122322111111111111.content:
The silence that followed Mew's visit was extremely awkward for you. Suddenly Glacia spoke, "That was good of Mew! I almost fell for it." Dewa stared at her with a confused look but then started laughing, "You're right. She really had me. I thought she was joking but she was able to convince me. But you caught her Glacia, but what was I thinking? I mean Andrew could never be so important." She said, indirectly being cruel. "Excuse me!" You say, irritated.

"Oh! I u-um didn't mean it like that." Dewa began nervously. "It's just that your so small and-and young I assumed-" "You assumed I couldn't do anything important and that I'm a loser!" You accuse. "No, that's not what she-" Glacia tried to say. "Shut up Glacia! This is between me and Dewa, so stay out of this!" You yell, actually making both of them flinch. "I've tried to endure your guy's demeaning comments, but I can't stand it anymore! I'm not some cute little pet or thing you can control or talk about so freely. I am a human and your equal and I demand you treat me as such!" You finish, literally screaming at the top of your lungs. After looking at the shocked look on Dewa's face and the teariness in Glacia's eyes, you start thinking that maybe you overreacted and acted stupidly.

"I-I'm sorry guys! I didn't mean to-" You begin desperately. "Just save it!" Dewa snapped at you calmly. But by the look of her face, she looked like she wanted to tear you apart. "I don't want to hear it, any of it. You don't like us talking about you like that? Then leave! Because it will happen again at some point, and then you'll just get angry again. If you come back here ever again, you'll be dessert for my next meal! Get out of here!" She says as she grabs you and tosses you out of her home. The giant door slams violently behind you, and you finally realize how badly you've messed up. "Good job idiot! You couldn't control your temper and now you have nowhere to stay!" You think angrily about yourself.

Not wanting to be miserable all night, you head towards the pond where you and Dewa met. It wasn't the best place to stay, physically or mentally, but it was the only other place you could think of. When you get there, you splash some water on your face and try to think about what you should do. You were so hungry, but you didn't think you could find anything to eat so you just take a couple of big drinks of water. "Now I just have to find a place to sleep." You thought, noticing the sky was becoming dark. You end up jumping onto a nearby lilly pad and just lay on that. You slowly brush the surface of the water with your hand as you drift along with your new, soggy bed. The cold night air chills your body to the bone as you lie there, no warmth at all. Your thoughts stray to your first night here. You were wrapped up comfortabely under Dewa's sheets while she laid next to you. You could feel the love and warmth radiating from her and you were happy. But now you were cold alone and miserable. All because you acted so stupidly. After hours of saddening thoughts, you finally manage to cry yourself to sleep.
1122322111111111111.title: Excuse me!?

choices: In the morning Dewa's already at school.
11223221111111111111.content:
Drew woke up at night feeling a gentle nudging sensation at his side. He spun onto his side to discover Glacia smiling at him gently. "Hey. I just wanted to check on you and make sure if you're okay." She said gently. Drew turned back over, showing his back to Glacia. "I'm fine." He said unconvincingly, "Just leave. I don't want Dewa to see you and I together, she'd probably get mad." Glacia sighed. "You really should just come back to the house with me. You were right. You're not just a little pet that I can demean and take care of. You're an independent human being that can take care of himself. You just need help right now, so let me help you." Andrew did not respond. "I know Dewa threatened you, but she didn't really mean it. It was just a spur of the moment kind of thing. She has a short temper." Drew scoffed, "I know what that's like."

"I know. You and Dewa are a lot alike. You're both headstrong and get angry easily and say things that you can regret." Glacia continued. "How would you know that about me? We basically just met and things haven't exactly been the best." Drew replied bitterly. "Okay, I was hoping you wouldn't be so sulky but I should have known you would." Drew suddenly felt himself be lifted up and then gently set back down on dry land. "What are you doing you!? I don't want to go back!" He shouted. Glacia shushed him. "I'm not. I was just taking you onto the dry land because I'm sick of getting my paws wet in this pond. What were you thinking sleeping in there? You could have drowned or gotten stranded or lost." She stopped briefly, "Sorry. I know that this is the kind of stuff you were talking about. Would you please say something? I need you to give me some kind of way to have you forgive me."

Drew got to his feet and looked up at Glacia. "The thing is, you shouldn't have to apologize. I was being stupid and over reacted and shouldn't have yelled. I yelled at you and made you cry for goodness sake! You should be just as mad at me as Dewa. I convinced myself that there was no way either of you were going to forgive and that I would have to find a way to survive. But then you come tonight, probably just an hour or so after I did this awful thing to you and you forgive me. It makes me feel petty and stupid." Drew finally stopped his rant and took a deep breath. Glacia looked down at the little human who had just poured his heart out to her. She was touched.

"This is all kinds of ridiculous. I don't have any problems with you coming back in the house. IF Dewa is still mad, then I'll keep you safe but you don't have to be afraid. Are you coming?" She asked, somewhat embarrassed. Drew chuckled nervously. "Well if you promise to keep me safe, I guess it beats sleeping outside." Glacia smiled, "Great!" She gently lifted Andrew with her mouth and quietly brought him to her room, trying her best not to wake Dewa. She set him down gently at the head of her bed. "Tomorrow morning I'm going to have you and Dewa talk alright? You two need to make up. Now sleep tight, you'll be fine tonight." Andrew fell asleep quickly, exhausted by his odd day. Glacia placed her paw on top of him, "Sleep tight Drew. I'll keep you safe." she said before falling asleep herself.
11223221111111111111.title: Something happens in the night.

choices: Go with Dewa (You guys just made up!)
Glacia is you choice (She was your shoulder to cry on.)
112232211111111111111.content:
The next morning you woke up in Glacia's room all alone. You tried not to worry, but you were pretty paranoid after the events of yesterday and soon start calling out for her. "Hush Drew. There's no reason to yell this early in the morning. I was just talking with Dewa." Glacia said as she entered the room. You scramble to the foot of the bed. "Did you tell her about me!? You weren't supposed to tell her!" You ask accusingly and afraid. "I wasn't going to, but she said she'd gone out to the pond this morning to talk to you, but you weren't there. Then she started freaking out and talked about searching for you and she got all dramatic about how you could be dead because of her. So I asked, 'Weren't you the one that chased him away?' That was a mistake because then she got mad and yelled at me, but then she got sad again and apologized. Then she started acting scared again, so I told her what happened last night to help her stop worrying." Glacia said going on and on. "Glacia! How could!?" You say frantically. "Calm down! You should be happy! She was so concerned over your safety that I'm sure you two will make up in no time!" Glacia said optimistically. "If you say so."

"Now, I have to get ready for school so I'm going to take you to Dewa so you two can make up. Good luck." Without warning, Glacia carefully bit the collar of your shirt, brought you to the door, opened it, and set you outside before closing it. Before you could attempt to get back inside, you were ensnared by a world of black and lifted up. In a few moments you were set down on the table and saw Dewa staring at you with her head on her table. "H-hello Dewa." You say nervously. "Hey Drew." She replied. Following the awkward greeting was an awkward silence that lasted longer than it should have. "S-so? How've you been?" You ask trying not to be unnerved by her constant staring. "Uh, about the same. It's only been one night and we basically slept away from each other." She replied. "Oh good." You say with a nervous chuckle. "This is ridiculous! Just apologize to her and be friends again!" You thought to yourself. "All right here it goes. Deep breath!"

"I'm sorry!" Dewa says suddenly as you inhale. Her sudden outburst shocked you and you ended up choking on air. Dewa quietly got you a cap of water which you drank from after the initial fit passed. "Are you alright?" She asked patting your head gently. "Yes I'm fine. There's no need to pat my head." You reply dryly. "Oh good. Sorry about that, I know this is why you got mad in the first place. Let's just put this all behind us. I really hate drama and discussing yesterday would just be too dramatic for me. So, I apologize for threatening to eat you yesterday." Dewa said calmly. "Apology accepted. Of course I'm not completely guilt free, I overreacted as well so I apologize as well." You reply. "Okay that settles that. We should get going, the bus will come soon and I don't want to miss it-" Dewa stops suddenly because without warning you had hugged her. "I missed you Dewa." You whisper. "Oh come on. It wasn't even half of a day! We were going to avoid all of the drama and now you do this! ...I missed you too." She said returning the hug the best she could. "Ah! You two made up! That makes me so happy!" Glacia cooed appearing form her room. "B-be quiet Glacia!" Dewa stuttered defensively. "We have to get to school. Sorry Drew but you'll have to spend all day in my bag again." Glacia huffed. "I could keep him with me you know! I'm taking the mythology class so we could learn why he's here or what Mew was talking about!"

"She does have a point you know Drew." Dewa said. "I'll let you choose who you go with. Do you want to go with Glacia or me to school?"
112232211111111111111.title: Confronting Dewa...

1122322111111111111112.content:
Drew looked between Glacia and Dewa, shifting his head to face each Pokémon several times. There had just been a lot of unnecessary drama and he wanted to make sure that his choice wouldn't cause anymore. "Ugh, you're taking too long for something so simple." Dewa sighed suddenly. Not waiting for a response, Dewa grabbed her stuff and started heading to the door. "You take him Glacia, I have to meet the others for practice after school anyways. I don't think he's ready for them yet." Without another word, Dewa walked out the door and out of sight.

"Uh, I choose Glacia?" Drew said, trying to sound like he made the decision. Glacia simply giggled happily in response. "That's more like the Dewa I know! I guess she was trying to be... motherly when she first met you." Glacia said aloud as she grabbed her stuff. Drew gently lowered himself off the table and into Glacia's bag when she motioned for him to. "What do you mea? You mean Dewa was acting differently before?" He asked. Glacia hummed to herself a bit and shut the house's door before heading towards the bus stop. "Yes, a lot different from my perspective. Usually she's blunt and aggressive and sassy and kind of rude But when she was around you, she acted more like me." There was silence for a moment as Drew tried to understand what Glacia meant. "Like you? So sweet, loving, friendly, and gentle?" He asked.

Suddenly, the bag Drew was in began to shake violently and he was tossed about a bit. Glacia's smiling face peered into the bag and her shining eyes locked into Drew. "Aw! You really think I'm all of that? You're so sweet!" She said happily. As quickly as her head had gone into the bag, it dissapeared from Drew's sight. "Anyways, yeah. Dewa was acting differently. But don't worry! Her normal self is just as lovable." Drew didn't entirely understand what Glacia meant but he had enough information to stay content. But something else was still bothering him.

"Glacia! What was the practice Dewa was talking about?" He asked. "Hm? Dewa's practice? Well it's for-" Glacia's explanation was cut short by a loud rumbling noise and a hiss of steam. "Oh! That's the bus. I'll tell you about practice at lunch. Stay safe." Glacia said as she stepped onto the bus. "Wait! Can't we talk while you're on the bus?" Drew asked, desperate to escape boredom and loneliness. He got no response, Glacia was already having a conversation with someone else. "Huh might as well take a nap." Drew said sadly.
1122322111111111111112.title: Back to School

choices: She doesn't check and leaves Drew behind!
She discovers Drew is missing and searches for him.
11223221111111111111122.content:
The start of Drew's day with Glacia was the same as his day with Dewa. Unable to entertain himself, Drew slept through Glacia's first class in her bag. Glacia, paranoid about Drew's safety, kept looking into her bag to make sure he was safe. She was only able to stop checking on him when her classmate noted her strange behavior. "Uh sorry I'm nervous because I have a... presentation and I keep thinking I forgot my notes." She lied, trying to sound genuine.

In the next class, Drew was woken up by some kind of strange noise. The noise repeated for awhile and then stopped. Before Drew could return to his slumber, the noise started again. This happened several times before Drew's curiosity got the better of him. "What could that noise possibly be?" He thought. Glacia's stuff was conveniently stacked to make Drew a path to the opening in Glacia's bag. Drew began his descent, guessing in his mind what the noise could be.


When he reached the open if the bag and stuck his head out, he saw the last thing he thought he'd see. Glacia was operating a sewing machine, seemingly very skillfully. "What? ...How is she doing that? She's a quadruped Pokémon right? How is she even reaching the table?" Drew thought as he shifted his attention to Glacia's rear paws. Her paws were balancing on a small stool helping to increase her height. "I guess that explains how she's reaching the machine." Drew said aloud, giving up in figuring out how she was operating the machine.

Up above, Glacia smiled to herself softly as she worked. She had originally been doing the extra sewing to stay ahead in her class but the moment since she learned about Drew's existence, she had decided to change her work to suit him. "I hope I guessed his size right. It would have been easier to ask for his measurements, but I want this to be a surprise." She thought. Her ears twitched slightly in response to a tiny noise and she reflexively looked down.

When she noticed Drew poking outside of her bag, she checked her surroundings to make sure no one was looking and lowered her head to Drew, startling him in the process. "What are you doing Drew?" She started concerned. "You need to stay hidden." Drew patted Glacia's nose dismissively. "I heard a weird noise and had to check it out. I didn't know you could sew!" He said somewhat excitedly. "What are you making?" Glacia paused for a moment before responding, "That doesn't matter. You need to stay hidden." She said pulling away from him. She gently pushed Drew back into her bag with a forepaw before resuming her work. Drew, now content with the knowledge of what the mysterious noise was, eventually managed to settle back to sleep.

After the second class, Glacia wandered the crowded halls daydreaming. "Hmm. What class were we discussing mythology in again? I only brought that up to get Dewa to let Drew stay with me, but I should probably actually take this seriously. It's not really even fun having Drew with me. I guess it's nice knowing a cute little buddy is in my bag, but that's also a stressful thought." Glacia thought to herself. As she continued to daydream, she suddenly collided with another Pokémon in the hall.

At the moment of the collision, Glacia's bag got thrown from her grasp and its contents flew everywhere, including Drew. He happened to be awake when he was thrown out of the bag and it was quite the terrifying experience. He wasn't exactly a fan of heights,and flying through the air at high speed completely unprotected in a world of giant Pokémon wasn't anymore agreeable with him. Fortunately, he was able to survive the fall safety under some of the lockers, he only lost his consciousness.

Glacia groaned softly as she recovered from the collision. "Ugh. I'm sorry. That was my fault. I was day dreaming pretty hard." Glacia said. Once the pain subsided a bit, Glacia looked at who she collided with. She was surprised to see that it was a young Espurr, likely from the younger grades in the school. The Espurr picked itself off the ground and dusted itself off. "No need to apologize." It said in a cute, young and female voice. "We were both obviously not paying attention, I'm sorry too." Glacia giggled happily in response. "Aw, you're one of those cute younger kids from the lower classes! Why are you all the way over here?" She asked.

"I was assigned to one of the older students to observe the classes and how they work." The Espurr explained. "My name is Espa by the way." Glacia slipped her bag back onto herself and began to gather her things. "Espa is a cute name. I'm Glacia." She responded. "I can't believe I never thought of signing up for that program! I love kids like Espa, that'd be the best!" Glacia thought to herself. "Glacia is a nice name too! I'll help you pick up your things." Espa smiled. She used her psychic powers to gather up Glacia's things and quietly slipped them into Glacia's bag.

"Hah wow. I wish I had strong psychic powers like yours! It would make stuff easier." Glacia sighed. Espa nodded lightly. "Yeah, it can be really helpful. I should get going now, thanks for not getting angry." Espa said moving past Glacia. "Bye bye! I hope you have fun observing classes!" Glacia called back. "That settles that! I'm signing up for that program next chance I get." Glacia resumed her trek down the hall, feeling like she forgot something. Does she realize that Drew wasn't in her bag anymore?
11223221111111111111122.title: Surprise Collision

112232211111111111111221.content:
Glacia was too occupied with her new idea to let her sense of forgetting something to distract her. She was positively giddy with excitement just thinking about her new idea. "Oh, I definitely I need to sign up for that program! I would love to chaperone some of the younger kids around school. I wonder where I would sign up for that... maybe the student council? I love kids so much that I might make this a regular thing!" With those thoughts holding her full attention, Glacia began to subconsciously skip down the hall. Her skipping caused a lot of problem for the other Pokémon in the hall and moved her further and further away from Andrew. She wouldn't realize her mistake until much later.

Meanwhile, Andrew was completely out cold underneath the lockers. Thankfully his flight didn't seem to injure him too badly but it certainly didn't leave him with the ability to remain conscious. The physical impact was so sever that it sent him spiraling into the world of his psyche. The transition to his psyche was incredibly bizarre for him. One moment he was trying to keep his balance in Glaica's bag, then he flew out of the bag with no explanation, and then he was in some empty white void. He looked all around him in total confusion. "Where in the world did I end up?" Drew gasped. He jumped in surprise as his words echoed repeatedly all around him and then settled into silence. "Glacia?" He whispered to himself, hoping in vain that she'd suddenly appear and comfort him. The only response he got was more echoes of his voice. Andrew groaned, very frustrated with his current situation. "Oh, this is great! I ended up in another weird place I know nothing about and this is by far the worst one yet. Why is the Pokémon world so strange!?"

Suddenly, a new voice echoed around him from nowhere. "That's a pretty funny thing for you to say considering that this is you human psyche. Hate to break it to you, but there's nothing Pokémon about this place... well accept for me." The voice sounded oddly familiar to Andrew, but he couldn't really figure out who it was because of the echo. Suddenly he felt the uncomfortably familiar sensation of being taken into the grasp of a gigantic creature. Naturally, fear coursed through Andrew's body and he began to struggle against the grip of his captor. "Hey! Hey! Relax, it's just me!" The voice said for what was probably an attempt to get Andrew to calm down. Obviously, it didn't work and Andrew continued to struggle against the grip that was holding him. After being forcibly dragged through the air, his vision was suddenly filled with Mew's face, a playful smirk upon her lips. "Man, it's a good thing I'm a gentle Pokémon. You'd never survive an encounter with some big mean one." Mew giggled. Andrew meanwhile was stunned at the sight of the legendary Pokémon but instantly felt more comfortable than before. He allowed his body to relax in Mew's grip and in response Mew opened up her fist and let him rest on her open palm.

"Mew, what's going on!?" Andrew asked after he had relaxed enough. "Why am I in my uh... psyche, or whatever it is, and why are you here?" The look on Mew's face after he asked that question did not make Andrew happy. "Well... uh might as well start with the bad news." Mew laughed awkwardly. "From what I can tell, you're currently completely unconscious. It seems like you've been that way for nearly the entire day because it's night time in the physical world. And you're not with Glacia or Dewa at the moment... in fact you're with two completely different Pokémon. Oh, but the one I can sense holding you right now doesn't seem bad!" If Andrew wasn't already unconscious, he probably would've fainted. "Wh-what do you mean I'm with two strange Pokémon!? What happened to Glacia!?" Mew quietly patted Andrew on the face, trying to calm him down. "Don't worry, these new two are really nice! ...Probably. I mean they haven't killed you yet or even thought about it so that's good." "That doesn't matter! They can still decide to do it later or make me their slave! If you can see them why don't you rescue me from them!?"

Mew sighed, she shouldn't have even bothered trying to comfort him, of course he'd be scared. "I can't rescue you because I can't see them. I can only sense their auras as an extension of your own. Besides, I can't solve your problems for you, how're you going to get used to this world if you can't solve your own problems?" Andrew, sensing that he wouldn't be able to get Mew's help quietly sulked to himself. "Is this because I'm one of those comet people or whatever they were called?" At the mention of that title, Mew's eyes lit up and she smiled. "Oh, That reminds me about the good news I had for you! It turns out that I got the timelines wrong when I spoke to you. I won't go into the details since it's already super confusing for me, but the point is, you aren't some super important savior of the world. In fact, there's nothing even remotely evil or dangerous about anything in this world! ...Well except for the fact that you're adorably tiny but hey, that's only worked to your advantage so far!"

Andrew remained silent for a few moments before speaking. "So... I'm not some super important savior? And that weird vision I had when I first got to this world with that creepy ghost thing was pointless?" Mew nodded excitedly. "Yep! I was the one that made you have that vision because at the time I thought you were one of the commit children. Those people never even existed in this timeline, so you're all clear." Andrew could feel his jaw drop and his head began to hurt. "Well, why did I even end up here then!? If I don't have any mission here why I am I even here!? Just to be some kind of pet for giant Pokémon?" He grumbled completely confused. Mew's face quickly twisted into a sad smile and patted Andrew on the head. "No no, that's not it at all! I looked into what your life was like as a human, don't ask how I did it, and figured out why you're here. You were pretty lonely back in your world. You lived alone for some reason and were anti-social and didn't interact with others very much. This was the universe's way of making your life better by giving you some friends!"

Andrew laughed awkwardly in response. "I guess it kind of worked... Dewa and Glacia are nice. And so are you, Mew." He added hastily. "But couldn't the universe have used a less extreme method!? I mean why didn't it just give me a human friend or like a pet? Did it really have to send me to a world where I'm so small and fragile? If I couldn't interact with humans or something weird like that, couldn't it have just brought one of you guys to my world? I mean, this is a pretty extreme solution for anti-social behavior!" Mew shook her head. "I think sending a Pokémon over to your world would've been really bad. I mean you didn't change height when you came to our world. We Pokémon are just gigantic. Dewa or Glacia could probably destroy your old home with a stomp or two." "Wow, that's honestly terrifying to imagine." Andrew responded, trying to laugh. "But I guess my situation isn't too bad."

With those words, Andrew suddenly began to seemingly fade away from existence. "W-wait! What's going on Mew!?" He moaned. "Oh, seems like you're waking up! Don't worry, I'm sure the two new Pokémon you meet will be lovely, good luck!" Mew gave Andrew a quick wave goodbye before disappearing in a ball of light. "Oh yeah, I forgot about that part of my situation." Andrew gulped. Pretty soon, Andrew had completely faded out of his psyche and was returning to the physical world.

As Andrew began to wake up in the physical world he felt an odd mixture of feelings and emotions. He felt warm, but also cold and safe, but also not safe. It didn't really make any sense to him. Slowly, he tried to stretch his body, but he was meant with a surprising amount of resistance. He realized that he was in the disturbingly familiar sensation of being grasped by something. No wonder he was having all of those conflicting emotions! He was surprisingly comfortable with whatever was holding him, but his survival instincts were resisting the comfort because he had no idea who was holding him. Any feeling of comfort was instantly replaced with cold fear when he heard some voices uncomfortably close to him. "Oh! It looks like the little creature is awake now!" Said one voice. "I can tell, it felt like the thing was trying to escape." Unable to do anything else, Andrew tried to pierce through the darkness and see what Pokémon he had been collected by while he was unconscious. Once his eyes finally adjusted to the lighting, he discovered that the two Pokémon were...

It was when he started to get sucked forward he snapped out of his reverie, "Oh what in the wor-"
